resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing this Angela! That is the SUPER experience we hope to deliver every time! Thank you for choosing MainStreet!

name: Pamela Ivey
text: Our service at the Urgent care was great ,Troy and Megan did an excellent job they were efficient in taking care of my husbands very bad cut and were happy to do follow ups. Thank you Urgent Care I’m glad your there.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us, Pamela! We're glad we could help your husband heal and feel better!

name: Brian Barrow
text: Call first if you can. Here's a secret even if your not needing them but you know in a emergency  this is going to be we're you have to go. Stop in and give them your information that way your paper work is on file. You will be surprised how much easier things go for you.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  Our goal is to have you in and out in less than an hour.  The registration process is much easier if you have the intake form completed upon arrival.

name: Busy Bee
text: SHOUTOUT TO DEBBIE IN BILLING FOR BEING AWESOME!

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: Bill Bettilyon
text: Very kind and friendly staff. The place was really clean and bright.

resp.text: We are glad that you were pleased with our staff and facilities!  Thank you so much for the positive feedback!

name: Box Kidd
text: Unsanitary.

resp.text:
Hi Caspian,

Thank you for reaching out. We certainly try to keep our clinics as clean and sanitary as possible. We would love to get additional feedback on what you observed so that we can follow up accordingly. Please email any details to info@mainstreetfamilycare.com.

Thank you!

name: Michael Humphrey
text: I was just in this place they refused to see me . because I didn't have a mask...,.. note I was just in there last week . And I did not have mask then ether nothing was said..... So what was the difference...... The woman who refused to let me sign in . Was rude and hatefull towards me...... The company that I work for pays them a lot of money to do our dot physicals .... But I don't think  they should be treating us like that...

text: They ladies at the front desk are extremely slow and uncoordinated. As many people that work on that desk things should be smoother and faster. The people waiting do not care to hear their personal business and the gossip.

name: Tiffany LaShea
text: Great, thank you!! Fast service and friendly. I only had to wait 5 minutes. Not sure why the negative reviews because it's the best experience I have received for drug testing.

name: Todd Milsaps

resp.text: Hello, thank you for taking the time to leave us this feedback.

name: Tamika M
text: I have been to this location a few times and each experience was wonderful.  The staff is very friendly,  professional,  and courteous. The rooms are very clean and organized.

resp.text: Thank you! Have a great day!

name: Boyd Blair
text: Here just for DOT drug test, DONT EVER COME HERE! BEEN WAITING OVER 2 HRS JUST TO PEE IN CUP.

resp.text: We are sorry we did not meet your expectations and we appreciate your feedback. If you would like to speak with us further, please contact me at (256) 494-4300.

name: GiJuan Pickens
text: I am currently sitting and waiting patiently to go to back for a workers comp. Injury. I arrived at 1 p.m. along with 3 other people and within the hour only 1 out of the 3 has been seen out of the walk-in appointments after 15 people who came after us were seen before us. This place is unorganized and intolerable especially the woman at the desk collecting forms. The nurse assistant or unit secretary Tracy became argumentative and disrespectful to a patron coming to preform a scheduled drug test. The patron ended up leaving immediately without paperwork.

name: Rodger Garrett
text: No public restroom. Unsanitary conditions.  They wait for you to leave to go next door to use restroom and call you back.

name: Jamin Carter
text:
Although you never want to go to one of these places, sometimes you have to.   I went in with an injured knee and the front end employees were very friendly and helpful.   The brought my insurance info to me as opposed to having me hobble back up to the desk.
The doctors were great.   Good need side manner and attentive.   They provided an excellent experience to an unfortunate incident.
Highly recommend this team!

name: Eslam el bakry
text: The receptionist told me that the covid pcr results will be done within 24 hr but it was was not done within 24 hours. As a result I am about to miss my international flight, whose tickets cost more than 2000 dollars. Absolutely, irresponsible people.

name: Theresa Rivers
text: Dr. Natasha Horner is always compassionate and caring, taking time to lister to her patients.  She is thorough and knowledgeable and is the reason I go to First Care. I recommend going to see Dr. Horner to get the ethical care you expect from a doctor but so seldom receive. Thank you Dr, Horner for your diligence and dedication.

name: John Nairemore
text: From out of town, needed help, fast, clean , very nice people who made me feel like I was in good hands. Five stars is not enough to tell how much I like this place.

name: Jayejaye Lawson
text: Was not the best experience. I was in pain from a really bad cut finger . They had to burn it to stop the bleeding. Was asked 4 different times where to send the my prescription by 3 different people . Was seen Sunday and it’s Tuesday and I still don’t have the antibiotics for the infection or pain medicine..

name: Kristin Rastall
text: Went for my 2nd Covid shot today, and had an anxiety attack and became very emotional. The nurse practitioner immediately came and spent 20 minutes talking to me. She immediately ordered some additional blood work and assured me that I would be taken care of. Highly recommend!!

name: Brandyn Leo
text: Some of the rudest people I’ve ever dealt with. Never seen a group of nurse practitioners who were so annoyed with the fact that they actually have to do their jobs.

name: Lauren Cardon
text: I have come here before and had a good experience. However, recently I went in, and their waiting room was packed with people coughing and not wearing masks, during an ongoing global pandemic. Literally not even anyone checking people at the door or anything. I turned right around and left.

name: Shae Smith
text: i waited in the lobby for   one hour before being taken to a room and then waited two more for anyone to come see me, absolutely horrible place, would give it 0 stars if possible. staff is very rude, and they hangout and talk rather than getting people seen.

name: Emily Rhea
text: First Care - we were given excellent service during our Covid testing. Quick to test and the care given by the professionals was exceptional. Ana Nunn especially was kind and helpful !!

name: Ronald Higgins Sr
text: It was a fast pleasant and informative experience!!! Thank you for what you do there!! Be positive test negative... Happy holidays 😘

name: Shelby Lamkin
text: Very polite and professional staff. The process for COVID testing was efficient and smooth. Would definitely recommend them!

name: Raven Lewis
text:
This is my second time coming here and each time it’s been unpleasant.
I came here on 8/31 6:30pm to get a TB Skin test for school. It was quick, as I was the only patient in the facility. As I waited, they loudly talked about their coworkers and gossiped which I felt was inappropriate with a patient in the waiting room.
I returned on 9/2 to to get my TB read, I got there at 6:05pm, as the directions said and what I was told was to come before 6:30pm this day but not before 6pm as my TB will be expired after then. I check in, at 6:25pm (no other person ahead of me) I ask how much longer it will be to have it read and she said “it’ll be 3 more minutes”.
Okay.. why was I not informed on the very specific time when I left on 8/31 or when I got there 25 minutes early vs just having me sit there with nothing being said to me. The lady at the front desk also had an attitude with me asking on why I was not informed.
Ten minutes later is when they called me to the back to read my arm, technically after my TB expired and after the time they told me to have it read by then.
I give whomever read my arm the paperwork I needed to have signed by the dr or np. I specifically turned the page and let her know only the TB section is what I needed her to sign. In the next room, I can hear the dr or np ranting about how she wouldn’t be signing all my paperwork because I didn’t get the vaccines there and how it was inappropriate. The girl who read my arm didn’t even bother to relay my message.
I get my paperwork back unstapled and out of order, at this point I’m irritated with the whole experience. I let her know how she should have relayed my message instead of making me seem like I was trying to get over on them, upsetting the dr or np. Also how inappropriate the conversation went with me sitting in the next room and obviously thin walls. She just looked at me and never offered an apology.
This may all seem small but to me, it makes all the difference with where I decide to go.
I’ll just stick with American Family Care in midtown from here on out.

name: Hellonwheels999 (Hellonwheels999)
text: It’s a drug test for a employer, how possibly long can this take certainly NOT a hour! I have done many for jobs and was out the door in ten mins! If everyone would stop jaw jacking it something might get done! Not coming back here! Absolutely insane!

name: Marilyn Pearce
text: Horrible!! I came in for a terrible migraine. Was the only one in the lobby and got called back fairly quickly. Waited for almost 1.5 hours to EVEN see a doctor. All while having a terrible migraine and nausea. The nurses continued to giggle and were very loud out  in the hallway. I could hear the nurses and Doctor in the hall goofing off!! Horrible bedside manner and no professionalism whatsoever.  Save your time and go somewhere else... especially if you are in pain!!

name: Brenda Cagle
text:
The nurse's and office worker's  was so amazing. And I meet the head Doctor
And he really  cares for the patient he's  with he listens closely to what you say and tell him he has the greatest  bed side manors and especially nice and gentle  . But # 1 young male nurse stood out the most with me on how he could get sumone to talk especially  when that someone  doesn't  wont to talk about how there injurys  surcome about . But I returned to  be checked  for  congestion  . He was so nice whn I meet him but he left the room while I was getting a  breathing  treatment  he had returned  20 min later and suggested that he had meet me before it disturbed me  cause I had never  seen him in my life time and neither had I been eczamend by him ever. But he had asked me was I feeling better I told him yes and proceeded to ask him about getting a  refill on my pain meds he said that I would  have to see the head doctor  for that I replied ok but asked him if he could write me chantix to stop smoking thn he proceeded to leave the room with a yes reply so I was happy to know I would  soon be a nonsmoker  I was just letting  him know about me needing to  quit , and be for I could say thank you he put his hands up in the air and replyed very hastily and snapped at me with these words I will never for get them either ( I  just cant deal with any of your problems  cause I deal anuff with  mine . ) I stopped so sudden and with shock and embarrassment cause I wasnt telling  him  anything about my problems so I walked to my door of the room I felt my emotions in my throat and I new I was fixing to bust into tears cause this doctor had no clue of what
I went through weeks prior to  my 2ND.
Visit   he spoke real loud then at me replying dont leave that room and step into the hall way to the nurses desk  and I wasnt goin to the nurses  station  and it struck me that I would be better off if I left and set up an appointment with  the head doctor!! But B4 i opened up the door to the lobby  area  he spoke loudly and hateful (DON'T  YOU LEAVE, YOU GET BACK HERE , IF YOU DONT YOU WILL NOT GET YOUR PRESCRIPTION ) But I was already embarrassed and felt awful and I told him I will just see the head doctor for my prescription and that he had no right to speak to me that way and I would  make sure I asked who was the doctor on duty  so  I would  never be seen by him ever again.  I never received a  apologie from him still to this day and I never did get to see the head doctor . Cause he put a complaint in  on me and the head doctor had a nurse to serve me with a  disclaimer that I was not to come back to any of the emergency  and urgent  care clinics  in   Tuscaloosa   so I still to this day wonder what his complaint  about me that was so extreme for me to be denied service for ever . All I done was leave because iv been physically, ppl and mentally ,emotionally abused all my life even as a child . And he had abused me mentally and emotionally  that it affected me  physically" but he never took any blame or owed up to the medical  board about what he done ,and acted towards me and what manner he spoke to me . But iam still punished for  his abuse towards me .so I hope no one else has or have to go through what I did tht day . I NEVER WAS ASKED , OR SPOKEN TO BY ANYONE ABOUT THAT DAY . SO YOU ALL BETTER HOPE THAT YOUR NOT  BEING HATED ON FOR SPEAKIN  ur amendment rights !!!!!!!!!

name: Jennifer Waters
text: Their covid testing procedure is painfully slow. Our family waited over 90 minutes for tests. We arrived with our paperwork completed in advance and there wasn’t even a line when we arrived! If you need a covid test, definitely go elsewhere.

name: Gail Harmon
text: From now own, I will use Med center North in Northport. They are the best!

name: Rhonda Gilmore
text: No line, no waiting, nice staff comfortable and clean waiting room.

name: Nicole LaMoreaux
text:
Very caring staff
Great Dr

name: Jordan Poe
text: Very rude! Will lose your covid test if you don't do the rapid test! Needs way better customer service! The nurses are very hateful and no mangers! Would not recommend this place to anybody!!

name: Mimi
text: We are so grateful for the quick COVID-19 testing we were able to receive at this location.  The frontline caregivers were professional and caring.  We received our results the following day.  Thank you to the team here who risk their own health to take care of ours!

name: Tamara Robinson
text: Their service is horrible!! Please avoid!!

name: Edward Sazonov
text: Very inefficient, slow and highly disrespectful of others' time. A mandatory COVID test was assigned to my mother. Had to be taken at First Care, not any other place. After 4 hours of waiting in the car, they still have not checked her in! If there is a line, could they take a number and call when the queue is close?  The reception phone was not picked up when we trying to check on further wait time. Hopefully we never have to come here again.

name: Cailin Kerch
text: Excellent care. A big thank you to the medical staff for their professionalism and warm/caring response to patients. Above expectations, we highly recommend as a first choice for walk-in clinics!

name: Patty Brown
text: Very professional friendly staff.  Dr P will put you at ease with his big smile and gladly answer any questions you have about your condition. They got  me in and out quickly. My first choice for Emergency care clinics.  Highly recommend😊

name: Princess Patterson
text: Excellent experience! I took my daughter on a Sunday. I only had a handful of places to choose from since it was Sunday, and I decided on this one because it had the best reviews. The receptionist was pleasant, the atmosphere was great, and we were called to the back literally 3 min after completing new patient paperwork. We saw Dr. Sumanthi shortly (about 7 min) after. She was pleasant, knowledgeable and explained everything perfectly. I literally can’t think of anything they can improve upon.

name: Charlene J
text:
I scheduled an online appt through the ALABAMA FAMILY MEDICAL CENTERS’ website. Received a CONFIRMATION EMAIL FOR MY APPT ON 07/08/20 @ 8:45.
The site directed me to this location (1st care), I thought it was odd, but I saw my appt was with Dr. Peramsetty, a familiar physician with AFMC so, I thought maybe, they have a new way of scheduling online appts?
Once I arrived, I spoke with the nurse outside(who was compassionate and understanding) regarding my scheduled appt on 07/08/20 @ 8:45 at this facility. She explained to me that the clinic does not do appts, and Dr Permasetty will not be in at all today. She also encouraged me to speak with one of the ladies in the office, because they would know more than she.
When I went inside, I explained to the lady about my appt, and showed her my phone with the email confirmation. She looked uninterested, and proceeded to say “well we don’t do that here, and I don’t know what you should do”! She also, was doing multiple things while I was trying to explain to her my situation.
I was in sever pain! I scheduled an appointment to see a doctor because of my pain and symptoms!!
We are living in complete madness!! A kind face friendly gesture or compassionate responses are needed! I pray those receptionist show more interest to sick people in the future!!
I will NEVER RETURN TO THIS FACILITY!! I can only pray your loved ones are never treaded so rudely in their MOST VULNERABLE TIMES IN LIFE!!

name: Teresa Rose
text: It is not true when they say 48 hours and you will know the results of a covid test.

name: Cindy Grimsley
text: Excellant staff! Very professional and friendly. Nurse practioner very knowledgeable. Great experience!

name: Kelsey Bush
text: My grandmother took my 3 year old son here after being up all night with 103 fever, sore throat complaints and chills. They would not test him for anything because he would not “participate”. Called the doctor & he informed me that they do not need the negative drama & were too busy with 20 patients.

name: Harold Beach
text:
I went there for covid-19 test . Never got my results back . They called me at 11:38 on
Left a message about me calling back to see my results . I called for 3 days never got anyone to answer to answer the phone .
Thanks first . I'm new to Alabama and I know not where to go even if I'm sick

name: Jay Bee
text: Great staff!  Came in after 6pm for a foot issue and they didn't make me feel like I was wasting their time so they could close up.  Doctor was great and listened to me and my concerns.  The nurse who gave me a shot was personable as well:)

name: Marilyn Fair
text: My experience with First Care was great! The staff was very friendly and informative. I didn't have to wait long in the waiting room or in the exam room. The doctor was very nice and knowledgeable and took time out to answer all my questions. The doctor and nurses explained everything very well. I will definitely be back to First Care and so will my family.

name: Brian Swain
text: Numbers they give you to call don't work and if you try to reach occupational health, they don't answer. How unprofessional.

name: mindy wiant
text: I had the best experience here at first care. It was the first time in a long time that the doctor and nurses was so loving and caring! I will never go any where else!

name: Megan Liljenquist
text: First Care is my go to!  I have only had to wait once for over 30 minutes and it was because it was the middle of flu season.  Otherwise, they are quick and efficient.  Doctors and Staff are nice!

name: Hannah Cooke
text: My experience at First Care was great! The receptionist greeted me with a smile and the nurses were eager to help. I was seen very quickly and the doctor was very interested in each of my symptoms and gave me the best treatment I could ever ask for!! I would highly recommend it to everyone I know and will definitely come back!

name: Megan Gunter
text: Always kind and friendly staff. Very quick, polite, and professional. Very thankful to have them in Northport.

name: Countess King
text: First Care is a hidden jewel. I went today and received excellent care. Dr. Remona Peterson and staff were phenomenal from start to finish. I highly recommend First Care to anyone looking to receive urgent care.

name: Jamie Radcliff
text: We were visiting Tuscaloosa when my 3 yr old took a nasty scooter fall and needed stitches. The staff was AWESOME and very helpful! No waiting and very responsive. Excellent cash prices!

name: Amy McGohon
text: Very friendly, quick to see md/ nurse practitioner, prescriptions sent to pharmacy quickly. Definitely will go back!

name: Ben Carithers
text: I had a great experience here. Really nice people/employees. CLEAN & quickly in & out. I'll go there again. 👍

name: Hue Nguyen
text: I've been coming to First Care since I moved here as a kid. My favorite place to go! Everyone has always been so nice and caring to me. The staff has always been so sweet and they always got me in and out pretty quick. Love the doctors there!

name: Maggie Badgwell
text: I absolutely love First Care... Dr Shepherd & Permasetty are two of the kindest Doctors I have ever seen!!! I see Dr. Shepherd if I can because he is the ONLY Doctor that has tried to find something that works for me instead of running up alot of bills that have been done, over & over!  The nurses are great and always helpful & friendly!  Love this staff and the care I receive there!!

name: John Knox
text: You are absolutely the very best in Tuscaloosa. Don't change anything !

name: Lindsay Sims
text: The front desk women were so rude. After letting me wait over 30 minutes they tell me I have to have my insurance card (after telling md it would be fine without it). I had my work fax over my card and they rudely claimed that wasn't the correct card. Instead of offering to call and get the info the said I couldn't be seen. I called to get the info and ironically the office had just closed (had I known from the start it would have been open). What if I just wanted to pay cash? What do those patients do? I needed an xray of my neck after sustaining an injury. I just didn't appreciate the fact that I could have paid for it with my flex card. Its 2017. Is there really only one option and you have to be so rude about it? How about advertising on the pop up that an insurance card is required.

name: Secunda Steele
text: Staff are  always professional and friendly. You are in and out in a timely manner and they are thorough

name: Cham Kim
text: They are rude to sick patients because we are not considered human being but CASH COW. Also, they are racist to minorities. I experienced it in person. To people who are surprised, yes we minorities get disrespected and mistreated just because we look like we can't speak ANY ENGLISH! (So stupid right? See how I am writing a review?)It is not some GRAND, MEANINGFUL reason, but illogical and nonsensical reason. Never going back here. This FIRST CARE is DONT CARE facility so conserve your precious time and energy from going here. You'll regret it. Instead go to Urgent Care (Northport) instead. They see let you in right away and figure out what you need. The doctors are kind and they actually CARE for the patients. EASY AND FAST. For simple prescription/diagnosis, you'll be back in your car in 30 minutes.

name: Lora Fairley
text: Facility was very clean. Front desk staff, nurses and the doctor were really nice. Good experience

name: Lori McGill
text: This is where I go if I am ill or injured and cannot see my regular doctor.  They are quick and responsive to my needs.  They also see my son if he is ill or injured.  I haven't had any issues with billing either.

name: Jonathan Bradberry
text: Great service.

name: Nikki s
text: I second what another reviewer stated. Their billing system is awful. The medical staff is fine, but not worth dealing with the mismanaged billing.

name: Robert Serum
text: Courteous and professional care at each station.   Waiting reasonable

name: Deborah C. Kim
text: This is a review and proclamation. The First Care should be recognized for horrible management of patients' billing, and I am going there tomorrow to file a complaint. To First Care employees and representatives, I am very disappointed at how medical-related personnel can play with a patient's health and welfare. Is it fun to STEAL money from patients? Is it fun to FALSIFY medical information? Is it fun to LOOK DOWN on patients? * I am not pulling this review down, and I am never writing anything good about First Care. I will continue to write ONE STAR EXPERIENCE(it should be ZERO STAR) with First Care review page. You should have avoided my attention, but now it is too late.*

name: Charles Greenberg
text: Professional, friendly staff.

name: Vanessa Fields Brown
text: I have visited First Care on many occasions and have found them to be very thorough in all my visits, the wait time is never ridiculously long, I'm really beginning to not mind visiting this place....I hate going to the Dr

name: Alex C
text: Staff was attentive to my daughter and Dr. Ramshackle Peramsetty is awesome!

name: Jimmy Adams
text: Decided to try first care after 3 other same clinic visits! Dr. Sheppard and staff excellant,  prompt in and Dr. Sheppard was very thorough looking at the meds i brought in and extensive questioning toward me to help solve my problem! Excellant bedside manner, important when one is sick!!

name: Chris Jowers
text: Dr. P has been my primary care physician for about 5 years. Wouldn’t go anywhere else.

name: Mike Lee
text: Prompt service and a lot of attention. Very nice staff.

name: Karendee92@gmail.com Crazyluv
text: Excellent Care I had WITH staff

name: Cayleigh Schley
text: This clinic is awful with communication, they do not answer phone calls, nor do they return documents. I would stay far away from this clinic, especially if you need anything for the DOT.

name: Keon Allen
text: In and out quickly, very friendly

name: Lanora Bayer
text: Professional nurse doctor team! My go to when I need to get in for immediate care.

name: Shawn Williams
text: Nice friendly people!

name: Kimbley Draper
text: Great

name: Alexander Aksakov
text:
Simple drug screening. Been sitting here for 2 hours. The only thing they did fast was taking my money.
UPD: 3 hours as of now.

name: SONYA FEAGIN
text: They are able to get you in and out efficiently. Yes, there is wait depending how many are ahead of you.

name: Owen Rumbley
text: Pack a lunch. You will be here all day. This place is outdated and almost scary. If you get the option, go to the Daphne location. I will not be back.

name: Scott Duplantis
text: I had an employee fall sick while working offshore. Needed them to see him late in the day (4:30-5:00pm). They would not stay to help him out... Told me everything I needed to know about the level of dedication/work ethic this office has. Do not expect them to go above and beyond for you. Horrible.

name: MarshClips
text: My family of 4 went to this location to have vaccines for our trip to Africa.  The staff was so helpful, professional and caring!!  The nurse that gave us our shots was the BEST!  She definitely knew what she was doing.  We went at 7:30 am and, after filling out the paperwork, the wait time was very short!  Need vaccinations?  Go here!! You will be super pleased!

name: Alexandria Reed
text: I visited this location twice. I had to get a DOT physical and drug test for employment. The staff was very nice and answered all my questions. The wait time for my first visit was less than an hour. The second visit was a little over an hour due to the amount of people who also came for testing.

name: Lance Havard
text: Expect to spend your entire day here. Taking 4 hours to get a drug test and physical. Still waiting to see the doctor for the physical.

name: Z Bell
text: Arrived at 11:55am and finally finish at 1:58pm! OMG!!!!! That's a long wait for a physical and drug test! Be prepared

name: Jared Harris
text: Wasn't happy with the service.  I felt I was skipped by a few people as I waited for over an hour just to get tested for a respirator.  Then had to wait again for over 20 mins for a doctor.  The visit before this one was good.  No issues.  But today wasn't even that busy. Total time 2 hrs 30 mins.

name: Freddie Crayton
text: Slowest place ever been here over an hour for a drug screening. Still waiting

name: Markell Carter
text: Terrible! I've been waiting 3 hours to see a doctor for a basic physical! Two hours in a patient room, come to find out the medical staff went to lunch  without notifying us and there's two of use waiting to see the same doctor. This is sad! They put you in a room and say the doctor will be right in smh this is just sad employers don't send your employees here for medical exams

name: q
text: This place is super slow. I wouldn't recommend coming here. I was skipped over by a few people. I only needed a physical.

name: Tiffiney Cooper
text: I have been waiting in the waiting office for over an hour... for a drug test.... crazy!

name: ladytay88
text: Dr Hamilton's a complete ass#@!£

name: Reagan Andrews
text: 2 hours to take a drug test!!!!

name: Eric Steele
text: Great job guys

name: Boyd Kendall
text: Extremely slow

name: Johanny0122@gmail.com Santiago
text:
(Translated by Google) The worst hospital I have ever visited, I got there with excruciating pain in my back that I couldn't even sit, and what they did was ask me protocol questions, they never checked me, they left me in a wheelchair outside and they only gave me two injections in the waiting room, then they sent me home without checking and no matter the pain I felt, horrible place, I don't recommend it.

(Original)
El peor hospital que he visitado, llegue allí con dolor insoportable en la espalda que no podía estar ni sentada, y lo que hicieron fue hacerme preguntas de protocolo, nunca me revisaron, me dejaron en una silla de ruedas afuera y solo me pusieron dos inyecciones en la sala de espera, luego me enviaron a casa sin revisarme y sin importar el dolor que sentía, horrible lugar, no lo recomiendo.

name: Henry Purvis
text: Why is it that when your back locks up and you’re in so much pain you can’t put your boots on or get in and out of your car that they charge you for seeing a doctor but only hand you off to a nurse practitioner who “can’t prescribe pain medication” I have never had any problems with pain medication and never will. I’ve been a few times in the last 7 years I’ve lived in Florence and they’ve always given me a shot and a prescription for flexoril, steroids and a few pain killers. I’m not going to waste my time with these places anymore. Thanks for nothing med plus.

name: Isabella
text: I was in and out within an hour. I saw Dr. Lee and she was very welcoming and warm. I usually come here at least once a year. I’ve never had a bad experience.

name: Rebecca Kent
text: Run, don’t walk, away from here! They never answer the phone. Front desk staff is horrible they don’t wear masks, and they refused to let me see my primary care provider they sent me to the ER , which the ER told me I should have gone to a primary care provider. They sent me away because it was a Friday and I was an inconvenience. The floors are filthy and it is clear they do not clean. I just left and there was blood on the floor in my exam room!!!!! The PA was very nice, but overall a terrible clinic I will not go back.

name: Sabrina Samano
text: So fast. Truly care about their patients. Had different healthcare providers the past two visits & all have been wonderful!

name: Linda Ealey
text:
I've been going here for years and always paid my bills but recently received a threatening letter (during these awful times with the corona where people are losing jobs and have no income by the way!) that claims this is their 3rd time sending me a notice (it's not! it's the 1st) and that if I don't pay the high amount that I can't afford right now, that I'm no longer able to come back and they will send it to collections.

What a great way to treat your long time paying customers, I'm never going back to Med Plus, it's time for me to find a permanent primary care Dr. anyway.

name: tyler inman
text: I have lived in Florence my whole life and it’s sad to see a doctors office like this. They have the WORST customer service and I mean the WORST. Every time I call, they have a terrible attitude. This is the reason I would rather go somewhere else to visit the doctor. The people at the desk are rude in person and over the phone. They hardly pickup the phone when I do call. I have to call 2-3 times for them to even answer. Not to mention I called last night to get antibody tested and they told me to come up there and they would, but when I drove 30 minutes to get there they told me they couldn’t test me and told me to come back at 7am. They did not close for another hour at that time, so the fact that they couldn’t draw my blood is ridiculous. It frustrates me and if anyone is trying to get tested for covid or visit a doctor in Florence, go somewhere else. Med Plus is not a friendly environment and they do not treat patients nicely. If you work at med plus.. do better.

name: Madison Stewart
text:
The staff and physicians here do not care about their patients. They are the most incompetent people I’ve ever had to deal with. Speaking with Brandi the physician after what happened earlier. Hoping to get a resolution but instead. She has no regard for her patients and defends the incompetence of her staff.
They will kill someone if they already haven’t and they will feel no remorse whatsoever. Do not go here if you have the choice!

name: Rachel S
text: Linda Lee is the best doctor I have ever seen! She listens, is empathetic and knows just how to help. She is obviously very intelligent and is the best at helping you feel your best. I strongly recommend her to anyone that feels they aren’t heard or is needing help medically.

name: Elaine Price
text: I would like to thank the MD who was working the evening of 1/23/20. My son needed stitches. She was very compassionate to him and to me. She listened and even hugged both of us. There is more to this story that I don’t want to share publicly, but let’s just say she was a listening ear and a shoulder to cry on when we needed one. She could have just stitched it up and sent us home. But she took the time to connect with us. She made a true difference in our lives that night. We won’t forget. Thank you.

name: Matthew Nowack
text: This review is a follow-up of my visit to this unpleasant establishment. Where do I start with the utter inconvenience of a visit this has been? The phone call: I decided that I would attempt to book an appointment (like a normal human being) and avoid wasting half of my day to be treated for a basic clinical diagnosis. This business doesn’t take appointments for some reason (because they’re stuck in a 1900’s complacency mentality). Thereafter, I walked into the waiting room and there were only 3 visitors in total (including myself). No surprise there, given the fact that this place is a nightmare. I was rudely informed that I needed to fill out administrative work regarding my visit, and I asked if they already had my file (since I have been here before). They continued to explain that my file was old (it wasn’t) and I needed to update information (not true). Around 1 hour later I was informed that INFORMATION was finalized. At this point, I was the only patient waiting for treatment. After a few more minutes of waiting I was finally called into the Patient’s Entrance. Wow, the holy grail of treating a cold/sinus infection has finally gotten prepared to tell me I need a Z-pack. The doctor proceeded to ask me the same 4 questions 3 separate times. They were rude, they were slow, and they didn’t respect me or my time.

name: Allen B
text: Came in with a severe sinus infection.  Went to another clinic the week before and they told me to go home and sweat it out.  By the time I reached med plus, I was in serious pain and could barely talk.  Everyone was very friendly and didn't waste a bunch of my time asking irrelevant questions.  Dr. Grutzik was very thorough and friendly.  Was starting to feel better within a few hours.  My hats off to Dr. Grutzik and med plus.  Job well done 👍.

name: Stephanie Cornatzer
text: Brandi Ray is wonderful she has been truly a lifesaver for my family and even my sister family. She is so awesome!! All the doctors are great and truly care. And also the best nurse in the world Alli works there and my son wont get a shot from anyone else! Lol they are all great!!!

name: WMBW Love
text:
I get a different Dr. every time I visit, I've been back to back,  most of them really don't know what they're doing, every time I go back I'm getting told something completely different.

I wish they would do x-ray, blood work because I feel like I wouldn't have to go back still sick with the same thing over and over, they'd prescribe me meds and then I'll be back sick with the same thing in about 2 months, it's like they're Dr.'s in training and don't know what they're doing.

Even my sister went, she was still sick after they gave her meds so she had to make another appointment (and pay) and get different meds and she's STILL sick!

I'm just going to find a real Dr. else where, it's not worth it staying sick and wasting money on their service if they don't know what they're talking about, none of them!

And all of the ladies in the back have nasty attitudes (the ones that write down your info and check your weight)

They also wouldn't give me a temporary refill on my diabetic medication until I found a  real Dr., so it was pointless and the bills they sent you are so high!!

name: Jordan
text: Doctor Ferguson is fantastic. Always professional and explains everything thoroughly. Sometimes it’s a little bit of a wait but not often. Worth the wait if they are busy

name: Big Hand Dave
text: In and out very quick. I was very impressed with reception staff. They were quick and professional.  The nurse and nurse practitioner was very quick, thorough and professional. I was in and out in alittle over 20 minutes. Thank you. So much

name: Julia Savoie
text: Did not listen to what I had to say whatsoever

name: Rachel Berry
text: Every time I've been here I've been welcomed with open arms. Doctors and nurses are always sympathetic to my needs. They consistently listen to, and consider my symptoms, and take me seriously. 5/5 Would recommend to everyone.

name: Jimi S
text: Brandi Ray is the Nurse Practitioner for General Family Practice there and she is a literal life saver. She is the utmost kind and caring and genuine medical professional I've ever worked with. She takes the time to really listen and address all my concerns no matter how big or small. And when I'm sick she works me in and has even stayed late to see me. If your looking for a Family Medical Provider she's your woman. I am so thankful for her and her guidance.

name: Major League Carpenter
text: Dr. Lee was amazing, made the experience as enjoyable as possible. Very pleased.

name: Mitchell M
text:
I had a very fast visit and the administrative ladies were wonderful. However, the doctor was talking over me and didn't seem interested in hearing what I had to say. Seemed more like he was ready to get me out than give me an accurate diagnosis.
All in all it was an okay experience.

name: Kaylee Walker
text: Dr. Lee was absolutely amazing with our five year old! It’s so nice to have a kind doctor, who truly loves their work! It makes all the difference!

name: Charlie C
text: Dr Lee is great, willing to listen to your concerns. Always a good feeling when seen here. Nurse practitioner and nurses here are great as well.

name: Josh Berry
text: Dr.Lee is one of the best physicians i’ve been too, she is great. Took awhile to get back there though.

name: Casey Corbett
text: Don’t accept Tricare....military and military families, FYSA

name: Paige Montgomery
text: Slowest doctors office I’ve ever been to. It’s not particularly clean, and when I was getting an IV the woman sticking me did not wear gloves and had sparkly long nails. I have never been to a medical establishment that allows employees to have nails. They were rude and dismissed almost everything I said about my own symptoms and body. I will not be coming back, I don’t recommend others be treated here, either.

name: Maha7951 ___
text: the receptionist was so rude oh my goodness i am so beside myself. It's your job to be nice to patients why work there if you're going to be mean?? If i could give it zero stars i would

name: Kristin Hawkins
text:
I had to go in today because of a fall I had, resulting in a shoulder injury today. I had to wait a little over an hour (it's flu season, so that's to be expected) before I got in. One thing that really left a good impression with me was that the receptionist made note that I wasn't sick and pulled me over to another waiting room away from everyone that was showing cold and flu symptoms...I greatly appreciated that, since I'm a germaphobe and have health related anxiety issues.

Dr. Lee is amazing! She has such a bright personality and she's very wise. She was aware I don't have insurance, so she made sure to check my injury to make sure I didn't need an X-ray, so I wouldn't spend the unnecessary money if I didn't have to.

She sat and talked about some personal issues with me and took the time to show me some exercises I could do for my arm and even some breathing techniques I could do for my anxiety issues. She's a great doctor.

Even though I'm sore and hurting, it was still a really good doctor's visit...and I say that as someone who is terrified of going to the doctors office.

name: Taylor Evans
text: Receptionist in this awful establishment was so unprofessional and very rude! Basically started laughing when telling me they couldn’t process my payment method tonight, due to nobody there to process it. I will never go back and she needs to loose her job.

name: Richard Cornatzer
text: Definitly the best walk in medical facility we have around here the staff is always curtious and professional I've never had any problems with this place or the staff and were very thankful to have doctors like brandi ray and dr lee and dr furgeson to help out when your sick

name: Joe Bama
text: Not the same without Good ol dr Ferguson around as much. He is truly best doc we have had. but new staff has really made improvements still go there when needed.

name: Johnny Vaughn
text: I've been using Med Plus since the mid to late 80s. Alway great care. I've received no-nonsense advice, and exceptional care at reasonable cost every time. Much thanks to the doctors and staff.

name: elmer Pierce
text: Staff is awesome and they do not make you wait all day.

name: Chandra Stewart
text: Quicker then the ER. Doctors where nice and listened to why you were there.

name: Freda Butler
text: Great staff and doctors. I trust them to take care of my family.

name: Steve Merry
text: In and out quickly.  Really good hours.

name: Avery King
text: I would never return to this walk in clinic. I have never felt so disrespected and dealt with such rude people in a professional setting. I would never suggest this place to anyone. After waiting for 30 minutes to see a doctor, they ask me to leave and come back tomorrow because it was after hours (they closed at 8 pm and I was there with all paperwork completed by 7:40.)  Not impressed with a doctor's office thats so rude.

name: Tracy Biggers
text: Walk in and out quickly.

name: Tim Spidel
text: In & Out! Much quicker than the ER and nice doctors.

name: Kelso Morton
text: The doctors are more than professional & kind .

name: Paige Smith
text: This clinic should be closed, and if they continue on the way they are, they will be very soon. Be forewarned that this tacky little "Walk-in Clinic" refuses to see patients who are 65+.  And I do mean AT ALL. They will not tell you that until they see your insurance card; then they will pretend it is because they do not see Medicare patients/take Medicare.  When I pulled out a credit card (a rather upscale one.... ) and offered to pay for the visit then and there and let's forget about Medicare, the little bozo-ette at the window just kept saying, "It's not my fault, it is just the policy." Well,  of course it is not your fault, little Bozo-ette, nothing ever is with flunkies like you.   I eagerly await, soon, reading in the paper that due to a monstrous lawsuit over ageism, that MedPlus has had to close.  Given other reviews of this nasty little place, they will have to close over a  lot of things.  Please post if you ever see a sign in there that says, "We do not treat Black patients," or "No Hispanics allowed."

name: Tabitha Griffith
text: After my visit I called and left message for the Nurse Practitioner to call me back and she didnt. And it was about the prescription she gave me. I will not be back to see her.

name: suyog moon
text: Service is rediculously slow..Doesn't matter how sick is the patient they will make wait for hours..:X:X:X

name: J S
text: This the horrible uncompassionate place I have ever been to I don't recommend going there

name: Steve Willingham
text: Great care

name: Haley Finley
text: Friendly And fast

name: LOUD N PROUD
text: Excellent

name: Dana Sutton
text: I have been to this office at least 5 times, and each time have experienced excellent customer service. Yes the wait was a little long, but compared to other offices it's similar during these trying times. The nurse practitioner that I saw was compassionate, genuine, and though. All the office staff are very kind. I have worked in the medical field, and believe me being treated in a professional manner is something you will experience here. I do wish they would hold open slots for the elderly who are not computer or cell phone users.

name: Angela Formby
text: We live 30 minutes out from the office and, after signing in on the web service, waited until the wait time dropped to 0-30 minutes before leaving our house. We sat in the empty parking lot for an hour before we started to get antsy. We received a text saying they were almost ready for us after we waited another hour. We went inside to an empty waiting room and were told it would be another hour— all the while my sick child just wanted to go home. The receptionist reluctantly “moved us up the list” (again— empty parking lot, empty office, and enough time for her to play on her phone) but at that point I’d had enough. My husband was able to get an appointment with his regular pediatrician so we left. Needless to say, if it was possible, I’d give zero stars. Never. Again.

name: Darrell Spears
text:
-edit- why didn’t I read the reviews before I came?!?....

I called at 11:30 am and asked to make an appointment. I was told that they didn’t do those and to come around 5pm when they would be less busy. I arrived at 4:45 and was told that they were “at capacity” for the day... They “close” at 8 pm and stopped taking patients   over 3 hours before they close... I drove 35 minutes each way for this nonsense. My other option was another Main Street but that will not happen lol. Steering clear of this operation in Talladega or any other city thank you very much.

Long story short: AVOID.

name: Katrina Owens
text:
I was given a 3 hour wait time... Sick as a dog sitting in my car. After 3 hours, I was told it maybe another 3!!! Total wait time from registration to receiving the text to come in... 8 hours!!! E I G H T!!!
Thankfully, I'd already left and went to my local ER. In and out in LESS than 2 hours.
8 HOURS Y'ALL!!!! And I have screenshots of the messages to prove it!

name: Miki Fuller
text:
No matter what time you show up, youll.be able to eat two meals before youre even seen. Theres a 3-6 hour wait every single time. But if they know the walk in, bet they will be seen right away.

Save time and money by going somewhere else.

name: Shane Parton
text: Hard working nurses and Dr during covid 19 pandemic

name: John W.
text: Walk in Covid???? Walk in and wait 3 hours.  Do not tell you when checking in there is a 2.5-3 hour wait till questioned many times.  2pm and to be told people in line before that have waited many hours.  To to other clinic.  Bad Bad Bad

name: C Jones
text: I went in for Covid testing and was told that I had to register online. According to the receptionist, the registration opens at 6:30 am and closes when 40 people have registered.  There were several elderly people there that were turned around because they had not registered. This is a bad process as everyone may not have access to register or may not know that it’s required.

name: Todd Alexander
text:
Maybe tell people you aren't taking patients in that long recording before they drive 30 minutes at 11AM

Edit:  And again on a Wednesday at 1:00

name: Melissa Lemaire
text: I've been to this office twice now trying to be seen early in the day and have been turned away both times being told they have a limit on how many people they see a day. I am sick and need to see a Dr. Hours of this place are open till 8pm yet they're not seeing anyone? What kind medical care is this?  No service and told to come stand in line at 6am and hope to be seen even though I'm sick?

name: Estefani Colmenero
text: I hope this place stays open and with the same people for a long time. They are the kindest people that you will ever meet, especially if you are like me, afraid of a blood test. I have had 2 bad experiences with blood tests in the past, and they totally understood. They are very kind and gentle with people,they really are great about making you laugh and not worry. Thank you urgent care, I will be here for a long time, hope you stay as long as I'm around.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind works Estefani!

name: Lizz Garrett
text: Horrible service! Felt like nothing I told them mattered. The guy at the desk was down right rude! And we left with no resolve. Wasted 4 1/2 hours of my time trying to get my 1 & 3 yo kids well.

resp.text:
Hi Liz,

Thank you for reaching out about your experience. We will certainly follow up with our staff. If you have any additional details that you can provide about your visit, please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com. We always appreciate the opportunity to improve. Thank you again for bringing this to our atteniton.

name: Blaire Butler
text: I went to MainStreet for a chest cold on a Saturday around 11:30am - I was the only patient when I arrived, filled out paperwork and got called back in around 15 minutes. Very nice waiting room, clean and comfortable. The medical staff were pretty quick in assessing my symptoms...did not ask as many questions as I would have liked and were pretty quick in prescribing me meds - I guess I just expected more of an exam/conversation but I just had a baby 3 months ago so am used to more involved doctors appointments! They did take my weight, temperature and blood pressure as well as listen to my chest real quick.  I was pretty descriptive of my symptoms as well as didn’t have much of a voice so diagnosing me probably wasn’t that hard! The nurse practitioner said she had seen a lot of what I had going around and knew what I could take with breastfeeding. Overall I had a great experience and will for sure be going back!  They offer water/juice/coffee hot cocoa in the waiting room too!  They followed up with a text and email and do seem to really care about their patients!! I am so glad we have an urgent care in Talladega!!

resp.text: Thank you Blaire! We are SO very happy that you had a wonderful experience during your visit. We hope that you heal better, feel better fast! Please let us know if there's anything else we can do for you!

name: Ashley Paris
text: Great Staff! Especially Katherine Owens! I hope I get her again, if I ever have to go back! Felt much better when I left!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing Ashley!

name: Megan Cagle
text: Never thought that the best doctors' office experience would come from an urgent care clinic, but it did! Everyone went above and beyond...from the front desk person to the CRNP. Highly, highly recommend for your needs. Sure do wish this clinic could be our primary care facility! Great work

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Megan! We love our patients and try to do our best to make you Heal Better Feel Better Fast! We hope you'll continue to choose MainStreet Family Urgent Care for all your urgent care needs!

name: Kayla Taylor
text: MainStreet is a convenient place to go when your sick. Katherine Owens does a great job making patients feel welcome and making sure they get treated in a timely manner!

resp.text: Thanks so much Kayla! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Matt Riley
text: Don't waste your time at the place nurse practitioner there is a joke. Went in for a sinus infection and she wanted to give me a bunch of medicine to cover up the symptoms instead of giving me the antibiotics I need to get rid of the infection like every other decent medical provider has done for the many, many sinus infections I've had in the past. If I wanted to try to mask the symptoms and not treat the cause I could have went to the piggly wiggly and got some nyquil. I came there to get my illness taken care of because I  got things to do and need to be well too work to provide for my family. I ain't got time to be laying in bed hoping some flonase and a steroid shot is going to get feeling well. It was a total waste of my hard earned money for nothing. Now I've got to go to a place that really cares about getting me well instead of trying to cover up my symptoms.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

We’re sorry your experience was not satisfactory, and we appreciate you sharing with us! We will have our Chief Medical Officer review your visit to see what we might have been able to do differently!

name: W Stein
text: Wish they were my family Dr’s. Had a sinus infection and were here visiting Shocco Springs. This clinic was very professional, very clean up to date facility. My family Dr’s office is not this coordinated.

resp.text: Great news W! We now offer primary care! You can schedule your appointment online at any time!

name: Dixie Roberts
text: The medical staff was great. But Improper music was playing in the lab.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your feedback Dixie!

name: Charles Hedrick
text: In and out in 30 minutes.  Very friendly and professional staff. I will definitely be back if I need care in the future.

resp.text: Thank you for your great review Charles! We are so so happy that you had a great experience. We hope that if you ever need us that you choose MainStreet in the future!

name: Daniel Castleberry
text: Nice people but for a 50 copay I expect someone to answer the phone and someone to call me back with out having to track them down when i need a referral and not be directed to a half working so called Portal

name: Lisa Kate
text: Great service

resp.text: Thanks so much Lisa!

name: Casey Jones
text: Usually we have no issues with this place but the last visit really did it for me. The lady in the front office didn’t wanna do her job & had an ugly poor attitude. The heavy set woman doctor we seen acted clueless. It was just an easy money pit. I’m now taking my kids to their regular doctor to get the issue fixed. That was just a quick money stop at their clinic. Ive never had a doctor tell me they didn’t know. If you don’t know, look further into the issue until the patient is fixed!

name: Jaime ford cross
text: First and last time visiting this location. Tried to do online registration from parking lot. Server error tells me to come inside and register. Talk to girl working the desk and explained and she was rude. Gave me the tablet and I register and go back out and wait. I noticed people register after me getting in and out. Check online and she had me register for Brewton.  When I went back inside very rude and told me to register again and wait outside. I would not recommend  this location to anyone.

name: Sara hennings
text: Poor customer experience. Courtney Lambert at the Andalusia clinic is horrible. They should not be advertising that they do Workman's comp.

name: Tina Roberts
text: Being new to the area we do not have family Doctors yet. I tried to take my daughter in to have an abscess looked at. They assure you on the voicemail that once they text you to come in they take you straight back to a room. Front desk said we’d be in quick because we were not COVID. That did NOT happen. I got the text, waited 15 min, surrounded by COVID PATIENTS, I said we were gonna wait outside. She said they are getting ready to take her back. 15 more min of waiting in a corner. After that we left. I called and told them we were canceling and why. They didn’t seem to care when I called. That is not COVID prevention. Why didn’t THEY stay in THEIR cars? I’ve had it and don’t want my daughter to get it at all or I get it again. If we do I blame them.

name: L L
text: we received our first covid vaccination, the process of signing up and scheduling was fine the staff were very nice and courteous and the person that administered our shots was very nice and very professional i highly recommend the andalusia location (where we went) to get vaccinated

name: Crystal Mcneill
text: I sat there from 8:45 to 12 to get "rapid results" 😡 also charges double the other clinic Wich I didn't know until afterwards. The staff was friendly but it was ridiculous.

name: Lynn Fehr
text: Went in today for covid test . I had my response within 15minutes.  They gave me a full exam. Several prescriptions.  This was not just a your positive here's you results Dr. Very caring.

name: Bekah Jenson
text: All the staff was more than helpful and reasonable considering they were at full capacity for covid testing. Patients were able to wait in their cars to ensure they didn’t overheat and the wait was perfectly acceptable for the conditions they worked with. The nurse and doctor/practitioner were kind and moved as quickly as they were able to. Highly recommend this team!

resp.text: Thank you, Bekah!

name: Olivia Mitchell
text: Sat in the hot car for 2 and a half hours waiting to get covid test I got the text to come inside and was informed they reached their "max" on covid test. Could have told me that before I had to sit in the hot car for 2 and a half hours waiting.

name: Brandon Ward
text: I wasn’t too happy about my visit. I came for rapid Covid testing and it took over two hours. I opted to sit in vehicle to receive a text when they were ready. I got my text and came in and was told to sit down and wait as soon as they can help me. It defeated the whole purpose. Instead I was crammed in a room with other possibly sick people. People at the desk weren’t really that friendly and when a customer said they were going to wait outside instead of being sick inside one lady made a smart remark about possibly losing that ladies I.D and Insurance Card.

name: Arnold Clewell
text: The free coffee was nice but after 2+ hours I walked out as the wait was unacceptable. People who arrived 30 minutes after me were seen promptly. I understand that they probably prioritize patients by various means. Regardless its unpleasant to sit in a waiting room with nausea and a sore throat for 2 hours. Save yourself the pain and suffering.

name: Dee Boo
text: I have always enjoyed these people and Ms. Wiggins is amazing! Every time I leave I feel like she has listened to my problems and done the best she can and ALWAYS helped me or sent me to some one who could if she knew she couldn’t. Love this place!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! We're so glad we can help you heal and feel better!

name: Kimberly Giles
text: Not friendly ..employee in the reception area are rude not helpful and the staff in the back was Great its like 2 different places

name: BiggSexii Aree
text: I dont recommend To anyone the receptionist is very rude and after speaking with her and telling her what services I came for she was even more rude. This will be my last Trip EVER to this walk in clinic save your time and money because you have to wait hours to be seen for a 20 min appointment.

name: Lisa Gunn
text: Very sweet and caring staff! Love that they have cold waters, juices and even coffee to enjoy while you wait ! Awesome place.

name: sunrise Dino
text: Very nice staff but with a 3 hour wait for covid testing, in a packed room, and no guarantee that they will have tests when it's finally your turn, I had to say no thank you. Why can't they count their tests??? I'll take my chances and NOT wait in a holding pen with a couple of dozen possibly infected people just to find out something they can't help anyway.

name: Tim Nahlik
text: I went on Saturday 1/9/21 morning when they opened for a eye infection there where fifteen cars already waiting so I thought I would do them a favor and request tel health which I did and was approved but never received a call so I followed up on Sunday 1/10/21 and was told I was approved and would be getting a call soon.Well now they have closed and didn’t get any treatment.That’s bad business to offer a service that’s not actually provided that’s why you have such a low rating.

name: Julie Rose
text: Very friendly and helpful. Dr went out of her way to make sure I was taken care of. I never usually have to wait very long. I will keep going back!

resp.text: This is great news! We're so happy to know that you had a good experience. Thank you for sharing!

name: Billy Lee
text: Sunday i waited 7 hours to get some relief for a sinus infection. The Nurse Practitioner said she called me in some stuff to Cvs and then sent me on the way. I go to Cvs they say they didn't get anything. I call the Clinic and they won't answer. I drive to the clinic. Its 2 minutes before closing. The door is locked and the girl at the desk won't come see what i need. Monday morning they won't answer the phone 30 minutes after they open. I go there and tell them CVS has nothing. They look on the computer and say it was sent and to tell CVS to look again and for them to call the clinic if they can't find it. I go to CVS. They don't have it. They call the clinic. The clinic won't answer them. I have to drive back over there. I tell the clinic CVS don't have it and that CVS called and can't get an answer. The girl walks in the back a few minutes. She comes back and says they are taking care of it right now. I return to CVS and wait 45 minutes. Still nothing. I went home (20 minutes away) and waited several more hours. CVS still didn't have anything. 24 hours later from when i first left on Sunday afternoon i went back again to the Clinic and they finally got me something sent to CVS.

name: Serita
text: You must get there around 7am for covid testinf.It is not a drive thru rather everyone has to wait in line outside in the heat for hours to get tested. Forget about social distancing as we are all close together. To have people wait in line in this heat outside while sick is highly irresponsible. I kept thinking one of these people may pass out at any moment.

name: Melissa York
text:
If you are from Fl and have medicade, make sure you say "Florida Medicade"
We waited 7 hours to hear "yes we take medicade but you didn't say Florida"  Seriously, she could have been nicer.

name: J.D. Bonham
text: I was visiting from out of town and needed medical attention. I went to Main Street Family Care in Andalusia, Al.  I was nervous being and did not know what to expect prior to going in. Once I checked in (easy process) and was seen by a Nurse then NP, my comfort level improved. I found the staff to be professional, caring, concerned and willing to help. I never felt the shot the Nurse face me. I recommend this very capable group of caring professionals and I thank you for your help.

resp.text: Thanks so much JD! We appreciate you sharing your experience!

name: Charles Nowling
text: The worst Main Street had to sit for 3 hours just to pee in a cup DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION

name: Tracy Willingham
text: MainStreet Family Urgent Care has the most amazing staff! They offer complimentary refreshments, ie. coffee, juice, tea, in the lobby while you wait although most times you are in and out within an hour! I will continue to bring my family to MainStreet Family Urgent Care!!

name: Leah January
text: I specifically said that I was allergic to a certain steroid when they wanted to prescribe that for my sinus infection. I was also asked about the medications I currently take. They logged it all down in their computer in the room. They call in my prescriptions. I wasn't even told what they were calling in. Odd, but ok. So I go pick up my medicine, go home, take it, and within an hour I'm having an allergic reaction to something. I go to the ER. They get me fixed up. They said there are 2 problems here. They prescribed me a STEROID that is 6 TIMES MORE POTENT THAN THE ONE I TOLD THEM I WAS ALLERGIC TO!!! There also is a MAJOR INTERACTION (doctors own words) with one of my daily medicines that I take. The risk is seizures. I feel like they could've killed me!

resp.text:
Hi Leah,

Thank you so much for reaching out! That is certainly concerning, and we definitely want to address this. Our Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Taylor has reached out and left a voicemail and the number we have on file. Please give him a call back as soon as you can so that we can look into this and get more information. Thank you again for bringing this to our attention!

name: Brandon
text:
Went in with a lot of neck and shoulder pain.

After two shots in the butt, I was in a lot more pain.
But after a very uncomfortable car ride home... I'm all better.

10/10. Would feel pain again.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing Brandon! We're so happy we could help you feel better! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Leah Blalock
text: I love this place! The free coffee, late hours, toys and color pads for the kids, this place really thought of everything!! Excellent care from an excellent staff!!

name: kenny Spurlin
text: Amazing staff and service they actually take time to find what will work best for you. they just give don't give you anything and rush you out like a lot of other's.  thank you mainstreet you made me feel like family

resp.text: Thank you Kenny! Treating patients like family is exactly what we strive to do! Thank you for choosing MainStreet and for sharing your experience!

name: Jessica Bulger
text: Please do something with your phone system. I have continuously been trying to call for 2 days to pay a bill. The 877 number listed is "not setup to receive calls" and the 427 number (option 2 for bill pay) just rings until it eventually hangs up on you. If you choose option 0 just hoping to find a live body to talk to, it hangs up on you as well. Update: the 427 number has now been busy for the last 10 minutes solid. You'd think with as much as you're charging patients that you'd at least make it convenient for them to pay their bills!!

resp.text: Jessica, we are so sorry for the inconvenience. We are working on the issue with the phones. Please let me know if are still having trouble reaching someone.

name: Joanna Wu
text: Bad service! Race! Attitude! Don’t tell them you wake up at 1 pm they will tell and give you the attitude you are ware !!!

resp.text:
Hi Joanna,

We are very sorry to hear you did not have a good experience. We'd love the opportunity to follow up and improve. When you have a moment, would you please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your name, DOB, and any details you can provide about your experience? We certainly want to make this right for you! Thank you again for contacting us.

name: Amara Evans
text: They have one of the best ultrasound techs, Tonya Machen. She really knows her stuff and truly cares for her patients.

resp.text: Thanks Amara! We agree, Tonya is pretty spectacular!

name: Heisenberg Parks
text: I was told to come here to take a urine test that it would only take 10 minutes. It's been an hour and a half and I'm still sitting here. My wife had to be at work 30 minutes ago. 1 hour in I told the lady at the front desk I had to go my wife had to be at work. She said he should be with me shortly. Now were going on 2 hours just to piss in a cup!!!!!!!!!!!

resp.text:
Hi Heisenberg,

We appreciate you reaching out regarding your visit. We always pride ourselves on getting patients in and out within an hour, so we are disappointed to hear your visit took so long! We will certainly follow up with our staff to see what the hold up was and ensure it doesn't happen again. Thank you again for providing us with this feedback!

name: SHANNON “styson76” TYSON
text: Since main street took over it is horrible. You can't get them to answer the phone. They are super slow. Not to mention they don't seem to have  a clue what is going on. I have to fill out new papers every time I go. They no longer see primary care on the weekends and insist you give them a credit card even if you pay cash.

resp.text: We are so sorry for your unsatisfactory experience. We are currently working on our phone systems at this time. Our community educator will be reaching out to speak to you about your visit.

name: Becky Baskerville
text: Waiting room stocked with juice, water, etc..Very kind staff. Dr. Norris was very professional and calming. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you, Becky! We love your feedback!

name: Kelly Wilson
text: Great staff, friendly, and professional. I appreciated their kindness and attentiveness to what I needed.

resp.text: Thank you, Kelly!

name: Jason Jackson
text: Went yesterday and staff was great kind and considerate.

resp.text: Thanks so much Jason! So glad we could help!

name: Vincent Shelley
text: Worst experience ever waited almost 4 hours for an employment drug screen! Rude staff, Clueless and very inconsiderate!

resp.text: We are sorry for your wait time- With the rise of flu, we have experienced longer wait times. Again, we are sorry for your unsatisfactory experience.

name: Gorden Litchfield
text: Was here with my wife for over 2 hours first time,,, then they said her paper work was wrong after waiting for a long time we went and got it right then came back and waited for a long time again for a drug test...cold in the lobby bring a coat...customer service sucks...

name: tami killough
text: Told my daughter they dont accept Ins for a physical to be done. What the hell is the purpose of Ins then?

resp.text:
Hi Tami,

Thank you for your feedback! Insurance usually covers an annual wellness physical, but they typically won’t cover other physicals needed for school or work. What type of physical was she inquiring about? I certainly want to follow up to ensure we’re telling folks correctly on this. Thank you again for reaching out!

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great staff great care

name: peyton bailey
text:
I don’t typically do google reviews, but I saw that they only 3.2 stars which is crazy to see because I had a great experience at the urgent care! I got there as soon as they opened at 8. Filled out paperwork and waited maybe 15 minutes which is fine. I know when you first open a clinic, you have to get everything ready for the day. I’ve been sick all weekend so I got tested for flu and Covid. They both came back negative. Although I don’t have tonsils, the NP treated for strep throat as the symptoms I described all pointed to that. (Yes you can still get strep throat). I felt that the NP was VERY thorough and made sure that I was taken care of. I will definitely be back!
If you ever have concerns or a problem please tell them personally. I am a healthcare worker and you can potentially be hurting others as they are going based off your review. People who work in healthcare, are there to help you. We have hearts for everyone and want to help as many people as possible

name: g-Baby
text: Was asked to inappropriately to " Drop my pants to my knee's during a supervised drug screen By male physician , my private parts were clearly visible already. . really would like a way to follow up with this issue also..not looking to speak to anyone part of  " Main Street Family Urgent Care "

resp.text: I am sorry that your visit was not satisfactory. However, we have certain protocols we have to follow when it comes to an observed drug collection. If you would like to discuss this further, please give me a call at 205-739-4879. Thanks!

name: Haley Isbell
text: I'm so thankful to have MainStreet close to home. Every time I go in they are efficient and friendly. I love that you can now make an appointment from home and that they will notify you when they're ready for you to come in. This cuts down on so much frustration and too many people in the waiting room. They always listen carefully to my concerns and seem genuinely interested in making sure I feel better.

name: L M
text: I registered online for an appointment. I got a text message promptly saying that they were ready for me. When I arrived the receptionist took my credit card information and asked me to have a seat. Literally 30 minutes later I went to the front desk and said you sent me a text saying you were ready for me. That was very misleading. I thought the whole point of registering online was so you wouldn’t have to wait. She said that was not the case. No apologies. Ended up just leaving and going to the drugstore and getting some over-the-counter medication for my sinus infection/cold. These people do not know how to hustle. There was no one else in the waiting room. I saw many nurses standing around in the background looking at their cell phones. Do not come to this location if you expect exceptional service. These people are disconnected and seem completely careless. Not sure why they chose this profession. Very disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about you experience. That is certainly not the Family Treatment we expect our staff to deliver and we will be following up with appropriate disciplinary action.

name: Larry Anthony
text: Very friendly and competent staff.  Excellent no-contact check-in,  just scan their QR code at the front desk - be prepared to take pics of your drivers license and insurance cards.  Nice facilities, short waiting time.

name: Ashley Talley
text: Excellent, kind, and efficient care. They’re very good with kids!

name: SCARLETT Phelps
text:
They are BUSY.
You will wait a good while. Take advantage of their online check in and understand that they're doing their best.
I did my online check in around 7am and was seen at 1:30pm.
I was able to wait at home until receiving my text to come to the office.
Once you are there you will be treated very well.
The Nurse and NP were both helpful and attentive.
Thank you for helping me. Everyone there deserves a raise. I heard so many people being rude to the receptionist, her responses were professional and kind. She has so much patience!

name: Jason Blackerby
text: I’ve been to this clinic a couple times and I have not one complaint. Both times the people here were very nice and knowledgeable. They have earned my respect for sure. I’ll definitely use them again.

name: Amanda Dunn
text: Had the greatest experience I’ve ever had at an urgent care today. I woke up with a high fever and cough so I immediately went online and registered for a COVID test. The process was extremely clear and easy. My wait time said around 3 hours. I got a text when it was time to leave my house and another text when it was okay for me to come in the waiting room. The front desk lady, was so incredibly sweet and kind. I waited about 15 minutes before being asked back. They tested me for flu and COVID at the same time and it wasn’t as scary as I thought and didn’t hurt at all. That nurse was also really nice and kind. I waited 15 minutes for the rapid results. The nurse practitioner came in to go over my results and was very attentive and did not feel rushed at all. I felt horrible but was very impressed and walked out feeling relieved which is not usual from an urgent care in my experience. 100% recommend!

name: Celeste Gable
text: Cant give less than one. I have been trying for 2 weeks to get medicaid referral for a patient there. They sent referral on wrong patient. No one answers phine or returns multiple messages. This is the MOST unprofessional medical place I have ever seen. I can only imagine the staff provides same subpar unconcerned level of care to sick people. If you live in a rural area it will benefit you more to come to a bigger city/town for medical attention.

name: Barbie Phillips
text: My husband fell on his knee and it was the size of a cantaloupe and we tried calling urgent care in Moody, to make sure they had an imaging machine for an ex ray and they will NEVER answer the phone and they don’t return the call either!!! Hours later we decided to get it checked as it was getting worse, drove all the way there..25 minutes Only to find out their machine was down,… So then we called Trussville urgent care and they answered the phone without any problem… If moody urgent care would’ve answered the phone it would’ve saved us some gas and my husband getting in and out of the vehicle with crutches!!!! You want courtesy...SHOW IT!!!!! Oh yeah...The parking lot had three cars in it there was one person sitting in the waiting room… Wasn’t like they had a line and couldn’t get to the phone

name: Scott Frishman
text:
They were slammed being that it is just before Thanksgiving, but able to get me in same day earlier than estimated.  Online registration was easy.
Everyone was super friendly and helpful, and i was in and out with my test results in 30 minutes.

name: jodi isbell
text: Laketrah the medical Assistant was fantastic! she made me feel comfortable and was so friendly and nice the whole. I am so afraid of needles and she talked to me through the whole thing and never got frustrated with me, i love her. That woman needs a raise!!! The lady at the front desk was also very kind and helpful, but i did not catch her name!

name: Melissa Jackson
text:
The people were just as nice as they could be!! If y’all were getting a grade in would 100!
However I don’t text or email my daughter does that kinda thing I just use my cell phone as phone...per my Daddy..Thomas Berry

name: Love Assoue
text:
The wait time was a tad long, but not absurd. They have guest wifi which was very convenient since I work in healthcare IT; so I was able to work while I waited. The staff was kind and knowledgeable about what I needed help with today. As a patient I felt that my concerns were heard and I was cared for well. The NP apologized for my wait time, but as someone who has worked in healthcare I understand that sometimes it takes a little longer than wanted to get around to see the  patients.

If I have any reason to visit the Urgent Care in the future I will be returning here.

name: Cami Foster
text:
Quick. Thorough. Friendly.

10/10 would recommend.

name: Joanna Nicholas
text: I would give zero stars if that was an option. I scheduled a COVID vaccine online at 6am when registration first opened. If you wait much later than that, the website will tell you that they have already reached their limit for the day. My estimated wait time put me getting the vaccine between 8am and 9:30am.
