I called at 9:45 because I had still not been seen and was told that they don’t “puncture the vial until noon to keep from wasting doses.”  Perhaps this key piece of info should be somewhere on their website, in the confirmation email, in the confirmation text, or in the estimated wait time. I completely understand not wasting doses but how about letting patients know this so you’re not wasting their time. I would gladly have registered online at 6am and then waited until noon to arrive at the clinic. I know this is an evolving process but it can be made so much easier if you are up front and give realistic and accurate information to the public. No wonder Alabama has only given a fraction of the vaccine doses allocated to the state.

name: Lashae Vick
text: The staff is soooo amazing the lady at the front desk is so sweet thank you for all that y'all do. My visit was 2/6/21 so pretty recent.

resp.text: Thank you so much for choosing MainStreet Family Care, Lashae! We're so glad we could help you heal and feel better!

name: Richie Clements
text: Horrible communication, customer service was nonexistent.  Times and policies fluctuated with each person I talked with at the Moody location.  I feel very sad for anyone trying to get accurate information from this place.  The system they have in place for COVID vaccines is more than broken.  I saw elderly people waiting for hours, due to this locations lack of concern for their patients.

name: Quinn Bee
text:
I will not be returning to MainStreet for any care. I have been using them for any of my non-emergency doctor's needs for the past three years with no issues. I developed a sinus infection with no Covid symptoms and could not schedule an appointment from the office. When I attempted to register online, it was taking me through a new patient process, so I put it off. A few days later, I was exposed to Covid through a coworker and begrudgingly went through the online process. When it failed, it told me to register at the office. Upon returning to the office, I was told that I cannot schedule an appointment for Covid testing multiple days into the future, and if I wanted a specific day, I would have to return to the office and register using their devices on that day.

I don't understand why a) I can't schedule a test ahead of time, knowing that I am currently in the incubation period, and b) why they are entirely unable to process a returning patient using existing information. Trying to schedule this appointment has been a nightmare and wasted an hour and half, at which point I still do not have an appointment. They have had nearly a year to figure out the best way to handle testing, and I find it hard to believe that this is the best solution.

name: Kelly J
text: Avoid this place at all costs. They’re rude and lie. My mother has been waiting for over 5 HOURS now to be seen. She’s been told “you’re next” for the last hour. However, multiple people have been called back in the meantime. How can she be next, but never be called? When I called to ask what was going on a rude lady at the desk berated me for asking. She told me that 80 ppl signed up before my mother and it was her fault for not signing up sooner. After that my mother was pushed out to wait even longer. NEVER EVER GO HERE. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

name: Hunter Wallace
text: Every time I have used MainStreet Urgent Care the staff has been very polite and caring. The online registration form is quick and easy to navigate.

name: Virginia Franks
text: Worst people ever. If I could give them a negative star I would.

name: Jennifer Brunner
text: The staff is incredibly friendly and genuinely concerned about patient welfare. I would move to Moody just so I could go to this clinic!

name: g hegenbarth
text:
Super nice group everybody was
Attentive and service professionals.

name: Michele Gamble
text: Signed up online, they got me in quick and everyone was very friendly.

name: Pamela Birchfield
text: Only giving this place a 1 star because a 0 isn’t an option. They opened @8... I was there by 8:05. Was told I would be waiting a LONG time to be seen... turns out I had a 12 hour waiting period. Staff is unprofessional and NEVER seem like they want to work. Maybe if working wasn’t an option for them, they would appreciate it. 👎🏾

name: Searcy Sledge
text: There website is lacking a lot of valuable information and their staff is rude. I was unable to receive the medical attention I needed because of their lack of information.

name: Eyram
text: My covid test results came 13 days after. It was supposed to come in 3 to 5 days. I ve to cancel my trip because of that.

name: Shannon Wilks
text:
It takes a lot for me to leave a review on just about anything. Normally, if I end up leaving a review it is because I have experienced a dissatisfaction on numerous of occasions. Which, in this instance, is accurate yet again. Main Street is considerably close to my home and therefore mine and my families first stop. However, over the passed several months I have been very ill on-and-off. After being sick for nearly a week, I finally decided to make a trip to just try to get better. I was tested for both the strep and flu. However, both came back negative. This is a typical situation result when I come here. The last several visits I have been diagnosed with a “sinus infection”, upper respiratory infection etc. When their PA told me last night I was negative again for flu and strep, with full knowledge knowing I 100% have both, I got incredibly frustrated. I told their PA, after she said it was probably just a sinus infection, that every time I come here that is what they diagnose me with. I have had to pay multiple doctors bills because of their misdiagnoses and having to seek out another doctor to properly diagnose me. To which each time, when I get tested elsewhere, it comes back positive. They said they gave me a “shot” to help speed the pain in my throat, and it is 5:30 in the morning and the pain in my throat is so severe there is ringing in my ear now which has woken me up in even more pain. So, once again I will have to pay ANOTHER doctor to diagnose me with what I know I have. This is incredibly exhausting. I don’t know if it is malfunctioning testing machines or the lack of actual experienced doctors, but the fact that I have been awaken in such severe pain and body aches let’s me know I once again did not receive the treatment I needed. With all of that said, the PA who was there did call me in a prescription for both the flu and strep after I complained I was tired of their diagnosis's continuously being that of a “sinus infection”. I know if I let a good 48-72 hours of these medication stay in my system I will get better. The problem is, I am in so much pain and the shot they “gave” me might have well been water.

Sincerely,
A extremely tired sick person

resp.text:
Hi Shannon,

Thank you so much for reaching out. I can certainly understand your frustration. Have the flu and strep medications helped at all? I'd like to have our Chief Medical Officer review through your charts to see if there's anything we missed or could have done differently. This winter we have seen a like of flu-like viruses that feel like flu, but test negative and will ultimately run their course as a virus. If there's anything else we can do to help make this right and help you feel better, please feel free to email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com. Thank you again for sharing with us.

name: PedieFen F.
text: Went in because I had obvious tonsillitis and could not swallow my food. My tonsils were flared and swollen and no otc medicines had been working at all to ease the pain. So I went here and after seeing the doctor, I got two shots that he said would heal my throat by the end of the day. Number 1, he never told me what was in the shots or what exactly they did, 2 it’s now 1:40am, I went in at about 3pm, and the pain has not even SLIGHTLY went away. I can’t sleep and I wasted both time and money at the expense of relentless pain and suffering .

name: Kahla Echols
text: The quickest Urgent Care visit I have ever had ! The staff was super friendly and go us back quickly. Great job Mainstreet.

resp.text: Thank you, Kahla! We're happy to help!

name: Crystal Dew
text: Had to have a preop COVID test. After spending hours on the phone trying to get this arranged, MainStreet was the only place willing to help. The receptionist was so sweet and caring. They really touched my heart.

resp.text: We're happy to help, Crystal!

name: Yvonne Howard
text: There is such slow organization at this place. Don't they know people are sick? Their paperwork could at least be filled out online. People waiting to be covid tested should be much more organized. After reading a lot of reviews, I decide d that all your apologies and nice employees do not make up for slow, poor healthcare.

name: Alicia Brayden
text: I come in to get seen about some sinus and I’m told they only see so many people a day because of Covid. What kind of health care facility only cares about a hand full of people. If y’all are so scared then you guys shouldn’t be called urgent care! Also I would take down the walk in sign since that’s misleading!

name: Sydney Presley
text:
I have been here several times and have never had a problem.  Everyone is really nice and helpful.  Plus they do a follow-up call which I appreciated.
I saw Nurse Practioner Becky.
Very nice.  I will go back!!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing Sydney! We agree, Becky is awesome! We're so glad she was able to help you feel better. Thank you again for telling us about your experience and for choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Tina Graham
text: I had a great experience at Main Street this morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful.   Thank you Main Street!

name: Talaysha Wright
text: Everyone was so nice and helpful!

name: Patrick Smith
text: I was sick with symptoms similar to COVID-19. I attempted to call MainStreet Family Care two hours prior to their scheduled closing time. No one answered the phone but a robotic message stated that they took walk-ins. I went ahead and traveled 20 minutes out of my way to MainStreet Family Care and arrived one hour prior to their scheduled closing time. The waiting room was empty when I arrived. An employee inside told me they were done with COVID-19 testing for the day and that I would have to come back in the morning to be tested. If only they could tell me that on the phone before I wasted the trip.

name: Aliyah Holland
text: Horrible service! Receptionist was rude. Attempted telling her I had paperwork that needed to be filled out by employer. She refused to look at it and continuously cut me off while speaking. While in the back waiting to be seen I overheard inappropriate conversations between doctor and nurses about how big a patients butt was. I will NEVER go here again or refer anyone to this place. VERY VERY UNPROFESSIONAL. If I could rate 0 I would! You guys are a joke!

name: gacha blaster
text: Great service

name: Jenifer Phelps
text: Was in and out in about an hour and a half. Slowest part was the waiting room but once I got to the back they were very fast and nice and took great care of me. I feel 100% better, thank you again :)

name: Trey Roebuck
text: They say they offer “primary care” but refused to see me.  I had a prescription (non narcotic) that normally comes with 9 refills. Then you have to see the doctor to rewrite. They refused to see me and said I have to see the doctor that wrote it. The doctor that wrote it is a doc in the box and I’ve seen 3 different doctors over the years to rewrite this script. I explained this to them but they still refused.  They came off to be unknowlegable of simple procedure.  I m insured and thought I would use them for the convince factor.  If they don’t want my copay that’s fine.  5 min consultation and some lab work.  Easy money.  I think the lady just didn’t want to fill out new patient paperwork. Zero star was not a option.

resp.text:
Hi Trey,

I appreciate you reaching out and I'm sorry our staff was unable to help you regarding your refill. I'd like to follow up to see if I can find any more information for you. Would you mind emailing info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your name and phone number and the day you visited or spoke with the clinic staff? Any addtional details you could provide would be exceelent Thank you again for providing us with this feedback.

name: BARRY DAVIDSON
text: Excellent Service and the lady at the front desk provided exceptional customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Barry! We're here whenever you need us!

name: Megan Proctor
text: Very friendly staff, I highly recommend. This place truly treats you like family. They really do make you feel better fast. :)

name: slydawg97
text: Sat for 1.5 hours for non covid related issue which on their website says non covid issues are priority. They then started to call people back who arrived after me

name: Nikita Ferguson
text: Had an experience with this clinic yesterday when I brought my child in after school. Someone who appeared to be the boss had her child with her and really just had a nasty attitude with everyone. After being called back to the exam room not only myself but my child could hear her yelling at another employee. Number one not only is it unprofessional to yell at anyone in front of god and all that's holy. Doing it while your child is there with you takes it to a new level of unprofessional.  Nice job moody.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing this with us. We agree that this behavior is unprofessional and isn’t behavior that we condone. If you’d be so kind as to email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com we would like to gather additional information so we can properly address these concerns.

name: Geno Osborn
text: I went there to get tested for covert 19 as my entire household has tested positive And they refuse me services because I didn't Have ID

name: wolfe whitfield
text: Sat there for almost 2 hours and they never even called a person back. My child sitting there with a 102.1 fever. Better off going to the ER than this place. I’ll never go back.

resp.text: We're very sorry that you had a negative experience. We strive to provide the best service possible. We would like to know more about your experience. Please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com and we will reach out to you as soon as possible.

name: Helen Crenshaw
text:
Please Please don't go to this place!! I was taking there last
December and asked them to do a pneumonia test on me, They said they did and I was fine.  The next morning at around 5 am I was taking to the ER.  I had double pneumonia and almost died.  This past Saturday my 7 year old granddaughter was taking there crying of really bad stomach pain, my daughter was told that they don't tend to crying babies.  They took her to the Er and she had to have her appendix removed. Urgent care dosen't care about you.

resp.text:
Hi Helen,

We are truly saddened that your experience was not as great as we would have liked. We take bad reviews very seriously, and we would like to ensure that your experience is better next time. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, and we will follow up this week. Thank you again for sharing your feedback.

name: Chris Trivette
text: Had a great experience, wait time was as expected, staff was very friendly, and helpful. I felt like they listened to my husbands concerns and addressed the issues at hand. They even called a couple of days after the visit to check on him and make sure he was feeling better. We would go back again and recommend it to others.

resp.text: Thanks Chris! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Bria Poe
text: They are super fast and efficient even with a fully waiting room. Everyone is really nice and professional. I definitely recommend this place to all of my family and friends.

name: Stephanie Long
text: Worst experience. Refused to prescribe asthma inhaler. Past records show asthma and breathing treatments. Doesn’t make sense it isn’t a narcotic definitely not drug searching. It’s an inhaler. They said they don’t know when their staff works.  Nurse practitioner prescribed flu medicine for 6 yr old and said she didn’t like doing it. Of course I’m not a dr and had to call his pediatrician and ask the pharmacist if it would be ok. Both said yes.

resp.text:
Hi Stephanie,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I've passed this along to our clinic manager to find out why we wouldn't have prescribed the inhaler as well. Someone will reach out this week to follow up. In the meantime, if you have any additional details about your experience that you could share, please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com so that we can follow up accordingly! Thank you again for reaching out and allowing us the opportunity to improve!

name: Hunter Goode
text: 6 hours waiting for a covid test you made me wait in my car  for four hours you made me wait inside for two hours like  what the heck dude

name: Jennifer Denholm
text: The staff was amazing. I was violently ill and they went out of their way to accommodate me. They even called my meds in to a second pharmacy when the first one closed before my husband got to it.  The facility was clean and comfortable.  They have complimentary drinks for the patients.

resp.text: Thanks so much Jennifer! We appreciate you sharing your experience!

name: English Farms
text: Took a while to get in about a two and a half hour wait, once I was back I was seen quickly and realised. I had payed my copay before I was seen, but they never processed my check and kept getting text messages that we owed them money, but our insurance company had paid, kinda weird I think it was a hiccup somewhere between the front desk and the ar and AP Dept. But would definitely go back. They were very friendly, and was much better than going to the ER.

resp.text: We're glad you had a good experience and thank you for sharing. When you need us, we'll be here!

name: Patricia Blais
text: I went on a Sunday with what felt like bronchitis.  I'm prone to that this time of year and have had mixed results with urgent care facilities, but this one was first rate!  Everyone was so nice from the receptionist on, and my wait was minimal - maybe 30 minutes.  The people in the back were very competent, responsive, and listened to and addressed all my concerns.  I went about a mile down the street to the pharmacy to fill my prescription and it was already there.  Would highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks Patricia! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: crosswarrior880 haha
text: A year and 3 months after I'd taken my grandson to this clinic I get a phone call saying insurance didn't pay....I called the insurance company and due to the fact that, main street dropped the ball  and never informed me, it was over the time limit  to pay. Main street then took $109 from my checking account without asking me first or allowing me to make arrangements.  I'm far from rich so this was a punch in the gut. They didn't even try to help out in any way. They said when you sign your permission for treatment it's in THE FINE PRINT...that you don't see. I LOST ALL TRUST IN THIS PLACE...WILL NEVER GO BACK.

resp.text:
Hi Crosswarrior,

Thank you for your feedback regarding your visit. I’d really like to look into why insurance denied your claim and find out exactly how we might have dropped the ball in this situation so that we can avoid this situation in the future. Would you mind emailing info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your name, DOB, and any additional information regarding your visit?

Our staff is trained to provide a laminated copy of our EzBill policy with our intake form so that patients have a full understanding of the options they have when it comes to paying their bills! We do mail a statement and give patients 15 days to make alternative payment arrangements or payment plans.

name: David Lang
text: They can't do much on weekend, want you to sign up and make appt. Better off at American Family Care.

resp.text:
Hi David,

Thank you for reaching out regarding your experience! I'd like to collect some additional information about your visit so that we can follow up accordingly. Will you email us at info@mainstreetfamiilycare.com with any additional details about what was said/when you visited/etc. Any information you can provide would be extremely helpful. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to improve.

name: david isbell
text: My elderly mom took my 5 year old nephew to the Moody location because his parents were out of town on 3/2/19. My Mom is not tech savvy. My Mom explained that my nephew's parents were out of town. The extremely rude lady behind the desk said she would have to email his insurance card to their corporate office. My Mom asked if the rude lady could help her because she didn't know how to do that. That question was met with a deep any glare and no  words were spoken. Mom felt shamed and seated herself. Finally Mom was able to find someone in the waiting room to help her. My Mom said she felt so belittled and humiliated. The woman behind the desk was rude and one of the most unprofessional people she's come acrosss. It would not take 3 minutes for the employee to help out my Mom. Never again will we be going to Main Street Urgent Care in Moody. Where has customer service going these days?

resp.text:
Hi David,

I appreciate you letting us know about your experience! Please know that we will be following up with our staff with some additional training. We always empower our team to make it right for our patients, which would have meant helping your mom send the email. I am sorry our staff did not deliver the Family Treatment as we expect. We hope we will have another chance to help you and your family heal and feel better! Thank you again for reaching out!

name: cvyblazer
text: This place was really good when they first opened but they are 3rd rate now.  They just act like they don't care.  You rarely if ever see a Dr, only a nurse practitioner and sometimes its a video conference.  MedHelp in Trussville is a bit out of the way but worth the short drive.

name: D Dumas
text: Took my mom there. Lady said we had a 15.00 credit so we did not have to give them her debit card this time. Well they must keep it on file. She told me they did not keep it on file and I gave them the debit card 3 visits ago. Not the last 2 visits because we had a credit. Guess  what they did.they charged her debit card for this last visit without my permission and I hadn't given them the debit card for the last 2 visits. Made my checks bounce and now I'm having to pay all the charges. This is wrong. I did not give them my permission to charge it. Lawyer time. Be careful they lie about not keeping it on file. I am contacting my bank, my lawyer, and the better business bureau and 6 on your side. To do this to a 78 year old on a fixed income.  Now I can't pay my bills. Beware this business.

resp.text: D Dumas, if possible please give me a call at 205-739-4879 so that I can get more information from you. Usually, are billing team sends out notifications about the remaining balance and will notify you before a payment is made. Therefore, I would like to get some detailed specifics so that I can follow up on this situation.

name: zacre101
text:
I have been there twice, both times i have left happy. The first time was during the middle of the flu mayhem, i waited maybe 45 min or more, but there was a room full of people. I've waited longer than that when I had an appointment at my primary physician. I was offered coffee amd water when I walked in and everyone was as polite as could be. For whoever said this place is dirty must be reviewing the wrong place. I didn't feel the need to constantly wash my hands or try to avoid touching anything like most doctors.

This time there was no one else in the waiting room, and I didn't have time to warm up the seat before I was standing back up to walk in the room.

Both of the assistants that I have seen have been EXTREMELY polite. They listen to my problems and symptoms and within a few minutes the NP was in there to treat my symptoms. This time she acted like she remembered me, which it may have been my file, but it really seemed that she recognized me and remembered the last conversation we had.

This place is a million times better than American family care. They gave me my prescription before I was even out of the exam room which was awesome. I didn't have to wait 30 min like other doc in the boxes

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review and we hope that you are feeling better! Have a great week.

name: Heather Dowling
text: For a walk in doctor office I was impressed.  Their late hours are helpful for people who don't get off work before 6:00.  My husband went for a minor issue and they called two days later to check on him.  The staff was great and I will be using them again.

resp.text: Thanks, Heather! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care!

name: Aquarius X2
text:
I went in on a Saturday because my normal office was closed. I got a call back from the office making sure I'm ok and getting better! I'm impressed! I think I'm going to switch doctor offices for good! Not only that, but they have coffee, water, and other drinks for free in the waiting room. That comes in real handy when you have a child and forget to pack drinks!  My visit was very fast as well. Beyond satisfied and highly recommend!

Update: I still visit frequently and always have as great experience! Idk how the reviews are so low! They accept Medicaid! So fast and professional! I love this place!!

resp.text: Thanks Laura! Glad we could help you feel better fast!

name: Glenda Harbin
text: I didn’t have to wait long so that was a good start. The staff was friendly and helpful. My only negative, I had X-rays and was told they should have the results a couple of hours. I called later in the afternoon to see if they had my results yet and the person who answered the phone said they had and I had no breaks. I asked about the boot I was wearing and she told me it usually takes a couple of weeks. I would have preferred the NP or the medical assistant call me with the info and further treatment info.

resp.text: Glenda, thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We hope you get to feeling better fast.

name: Christina Harris
text: Staff was very nice! Np was very helpful with explaining my concerns and courteous about my time and cost of the visit. Def recommending friends and family.

resp.text: Thanks Christina!

name: Steven Gray
text: Terrible service.  Walked in at 1:00 pm. 1 person in waiting room.  Just needed a shot to treat poison ivy. Waited for 1 hr before going to room.  Waited in room for 1 1/2 hrs.  Never saw a doctor.  Got a refund and will never go back. 2 1/2 hours wasted. North side medical in and out 25 minutes total.

resp.text:
Hi Steven,

Thank you so much for reaching out regarding your experience. Company wide we are proud to say that we typically get patients in and out in under an hour, but naturally that can be longer during peak season. I will have a manager follow up with your chart so that we can help our staff be most efficient during those busy times. I’m glad we were able to issue a refund as well! Thank you again for alerting us to this!

name: Betsy Stewart
text: Really friendly staff and thankfully open weekends! I'd already been to another Urgent Care during the week and they told me I didn't have strep, but turns out I did! Ellen Hamby is one of the nurse practitioners there and she was GREAT! Got two shots and was able to get my prescription filled there which was great since I felt like death! Oh and they offer free coffee and water in the lobby too! Overall, pretty great for being so sick!

resp.text: Betsy, thank you for the sweet review! Please let us know if we can help you with anything in the future!

name: Christina Harris
text: Staff was very nice! Np was very helpful with explaining my concerns and courteous about my time and cost of the visit. Def recommending friends and family.

resp.text: Thanks Christina!

name: Kaylie Howard
text: Do not go here. They have absolutely no idea what they are doing or telling you. I have been for 3 separate issues and they were wrong each time with what the diagnosed and ended up causing me a lot of wasted money and time.

resp.text:
Hi Kaylie,

We're sorry to hear that your experience with MainStreet Family Care has been unsatisfactory. There are certainly some things that are beyond the scope of what we can diagnose or treat, and we're always happy to ensure our patients get the right specialty care and follow up. We'd love to have our Chief Medical Officer review your charts to see what we could have done differently in terms of diagnosis and treatment. Would it be ok if someone reaches out to you to get more information?

name: d. webb.
text: worse staff and facility!!! came in bleeding profusely and it was a worker’s compensation claim and they took 30 minutes to even tell me that my company needed an account then another hour to tell me that they would need to send an email to set this up and didn’t know how long it would take and was still bleeding non stop and they didn’t even offer any assistance so i had to leave and go to grandview

name: Judy Blue Dog
text: This place has certainly changed in a short amount of time.  Walked in this morning and the first thing I'm told is I have to give them a debit card number or make a $125 deposit before I can be seen ... all without even saying hello or asking to verify my insurance coverage, which I do have.  It's very obvious what is most important here, and it's not patient care.

resp.text:
Judy, we are very sorry that you did not have a great experience. Someone will be in touch with you soon to discuss this in more detail.

Judy, I called and left you a message. I would like to discuss this situation in more detail. Please give me a call at your earliest convenience.

name: Amanda Phillips
text: Service is good. They know what they’re doing and they have the nicest staff (Rebecca, CRNP BETH, Kim, Dee) and made me feel very comfortable when I got nervous. They are so nice and get you in very quick. 👍

resp.text: Thanks Amanda!

name: Teresa McCutcheon
text: Very friendly staff.  Gets you in and out quickly!

name: Marie Jackson
text: I tried to be seen a week ago and I was told that they would not see me because I had an expired driver's license. I was told by the girl at the front desk that the driver's license being current had to do with insurance. I ended up having to go to the ER for kidney stones and a severe UTI. I was very sick and it only mattered to these people that they got the money from me and my insurance company. I wouldn't suggest this place to my worst enemy!

resp.text:
Hi Marie,

Unfortunately, insurance companies do require that we verify your identity with a valid government ID, which is why it's company policy. Patients always have to option to be seen without insurance with our self-pay price. However, it sounds like the ER was the best place for you care since we cannot treat kidney stones! Thank you again for reaching out, and we hope you get to feeling better!

name: Natalie Hottel
text: In times of sickness, it can be so easy to feel alone. Thank goodness for the friendly faces, fast service, and family values of MainStreet Family Urgent Care! This facility and this staff were truly a beacon of light in the otherwise dark abyss of my illness and poor health. Not only did I get the attention and medicine I needed, in half the wait time thanks to their TeleHealth technology, I also got a booster shot to the soul, if you will, from being treated by a team of compassionate, competent, and downright charming individuals. I cannot offer enough praise for this facility. No one wants to get sick, but knowing MainStreet is right down the road, I certainly feel confident I will be taken well care of when that time comes again.

resp.text: Natalie, thank you so much for the sweet review. Please let us know if we can help you with anything in the future.

name: Sam Eskildsen
text:
Really great! Fast.
Can get meds there. Clean and very friendly.

resp.text: Sam, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. Please let us know if we can help you with anything in the future.

name: Micah Nash
text: Took my son here after 3 failed attempts to get treatment for his cough and runny nose at his primary care doc. No wait, no issues with insurance, took him straight back and treated him like a regular. They actually figured out the problem and wrote prescriptions accordingly. Nice, professional ladies who treat you like family. Will continue to use Main Street

resp.text: Thanks so much Micah!

name: Brooklyn Hallman
text: This is utterly ridiculous. The lady up at the front said it would take 1- hour for me to see somebody and it took me 2 1/2 almost three. I have been here since almost 12:30 and it is almost 4:15. People continuously say that their service is amazing, and the truth is that it is horrible. Just horrible. I could go to the emergency room and get out by time i actually get seen here. I am most definitely not coming back here again.

resp.text:
Hi Brooklyn! Thank you so much for reaching out! Our goal is to always get our patients in and out with in an hour, but certainly during peak season, if we get a lot of folks coming in all at once,
It can certainly increase the wait time. We do educate our staff to try and give an accurate estimate or recommend patients come back later if the wait gets too long. We’ll certainly follow up with our staff at this clinic!

name: Holly Lipsey
text: Great docs and nurses. Not fast but they were packed. Still a good experience.

resp.text: Thanks so much Holly!

name: LVP
text: I was very impressed with the staff when I arrived. My wait time was less than 20 minutes, the facility was very clean, the nurse practitioner was kind and prescribed an antibiotic and steroid shot for my sinus or ear infection (she didn't determine which I had). The shot worked wonders for the first day and a half, I didn't receive the follow up call in 2 to 3 days that I was told to expect, nor did the antibiotic work. When I called back on day 4, I was told to come in again (which would have been avoided if they had called Day 2 or 3 to confirm the prescription was working) then I saw what was billed to BCBS....almost $400 for the office visit and shot, plus $150 billed to me of which I owed $10!? The over all experience was reminiscent of buying a shiny used car then realizing you are paying $20k for that $6k car but the payments fit your budget.

resp.text:
Lynn Price I am so sorry that you did not have a great experience. Someone will be in contact with you soon.

Ms. Price, I tried to give you a call and I left you a message. If possible, please give me a call when you get a chance. Have a great day!

name: Judy Walker
text: I took my children to the main street Family Urgent Care in Moody Alabama they are excellent we didn't have to sit in the waiting room for hours we were in and out in less than an hour they take very good care of their patients and I highly recommend them it was a great experience and so happy to not have to be sitting there for hours as you do in the emergency room I will definitely be using them from now on.

resp.text: Judy, thank you for taking the time to give us a sweet review. Please let us know if we can help you with anything at all.

name: Avery Michaels
text:
This is the saddest excuse for a clinic I’ve ever seen. I would be surprised if they could bandage a scraped knee.

Today my special needs child was treated with so much disrespect that my goal is to have the staff educated or get in touch with the owner to re-staff. I have been through a lot with my son but to have him treated or rather NOT treated as the case may be, was unacceptable. The NP didn’t want to touch him. She called him a “liability.” He is a child! As a healthcare professional, I am appalled that this place is still in business.

Eventually she glanced in his ears, listened to one lung, and called in an antibiotic. She said he had a cold. She said he needed an antibiotic. Antibiotics aren’t for viral colds. He has acute sinusitis and an ear infection. I hope people will stop going to this place. Find a real doctor for treatment. I want to know how legal it is for NP’s to run a clinic with no physician oversight. Sounds like a project.

resp.text: Hi Avery, we really appreciate your feedback and it certainly seems we have some areas to improve upon. I’ve passed along your feedback to our operations team so that we can come up with some protocols and resources for how to make a positive experience for ALL of our patients. We truly thank you for alerting us to this.

name: anthony d.
text: Do you have something against somebody feeling better, eating better, working better, or sleeping better? Just curious. Thanks

resp.text: Hi Paul! We appreciate you reaching out. Certainly we support wellness in all its forms. Can you provide us with some more details about your experience? We’re always seeking to improve! If possible, please email info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with any additional details about your visit.

name: Richard Bowman
text:
Best care I have ever received at any urgent care facility and I have been to quite a few in my 64 years.
The whole staff:
Dee-front desk
Beth-cma
Rebecca-crnp and
Kim should all be commended
I arrived at 8am and was back home by 9am , I would definetly recommend this location for anyone needing medical care in this area.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing Cole!

name: Wendy Lane
text: I have carried my son here when he was sick.  Main Street is the best I give them a 5 star . Everyone  was friendly,  not a long wait time they were getting them in and out. The nurse  practioner  did a very thorough exam. When she was done she went to get test results she brought a hand out on what he had . That was a big help. She gave us time to ask  questions.  They were all so friendly  and helpful  the place was clean. They had drinks and  refreshments in the lobby. It's  just a awsome place to go they really make you feel better by being there knowing they are going to take care of you.

resp.text: Wendy, thank you for giving us a 5 star review. We are so glad we were here to help your son heal better and feel better fast!

name: Patricia mankowski
text: Medicare fraud, they wanted have my debit card on file and collect a copay when I am Medicare primary and a valid secondary. When I tried to explain that they couldn’t do that she said well we can by pass the insurance and collect a patient deposit. Ummm hello

resp.text: Patti, I am sorry that your visit was not satisfactory. Currently, we are trying out a new billing policy that does require a debit card incase you have not met your deductible. Unfortunately, I can not find you in our system to give you a call and I would like the opportunity to explain our policy in detail. If possible, please give me a call at 205-739-4879. Have a great day!

name: Mike Fortenberry
text:
Although this is th height of flu season and I am sure your office has been over run with patients I was greeted with a smile and very courteous employees. The staff through the whole process was very pleasant
and answered all my questions. I will go back for my care in the future.

resp.text: Mike, thank you so much for the review. We hope you are feeling better and please let us know if you need anything.

name: Chelsea Wadley
text: I had a wonderful experience at this clinic! Everyone was so nice and helpful. The facility was very clean. Will def be coming back!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review, have a great week!

name: dylan Cosper
text: The late hours are awesome for people who don’t get off late! The staff is very nice and kind! Awesome place overall!

resp.text: Yes, we are happy to offer extended hours to serve everyone. Please do not hesitate to let us know if you need anything at all. Have a great day!

name: Blake Bjornson
text: Came here on a Saturday because my normal doctors office is closed on the weekend. Told them my symptoms, and they tested me for strep and flu. Both tests came back negative and I was told “I guess you have an upper respiratory infection.” They gave me medicine and I left. Monday morning came and I was feeling worse than I did Saturday when I went to mainstreet urgent care. So I went to my regular doctor and told him the SAME symptoms I told the doctor at mainstreet, and he immediately ordered blood work. Turns out I had mono not an “upper respiratory infection.” Mainstreet just seemed to want me to get out as fast as possible. Now I have to pay them a ridiculous amount of money for my “upper respiratory infection.” Do not go here, go to any other doctor possible.

name: Dennis Pappas
text:
This place is GARBAGE!  Slow as can possibly be. I feel like I’m going to catch something while I wait in the waiting room which btw has been over 2 hrs and I know I’m not even next or close to next.  If your sick and need URGENT care then it would be in your best interest to keep driving and look elsewhere. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Update: I was there for over 3.5 hours. The management of this place is terrible.  There was one NP seeing patients and it was about 30+ min per person. As stated previously avoid this place. I wish google would let me give a zero or a negative star.

resp.text: Dennis, thank you so much for taking the time to speak with me today. I have made notes on the things we discussed and I will let our management team know your concerns. We hope you feel better soon!

name: Jessica Isbell
text: When this place first opened they were great.   Even when crowded, they were friendly, efficient, and professional.    The past two visits we've had were terrible.  The 1st we were one of only 3 families and spent nearly 2 hours there.  The lady at the front desk avoided speaking as much as possible and seemed very unhappy to be there.  The wait times once in the room were long with 45 minute delay between when my son was swabbed for the flu test and when results were given.  When I stepped into the hall to ask about the delay the lady behind the desk got smart with me and said something about having to key it in.   The second visit we were the 2nd people inside and signed in at 8:00.  Didn't even get called back until close to 8:45.  Until there is a change in the staff, we will not be back.

resp.text:
Hi Jessica,

Thank you so much for reaching out, and I truly apologize that your experience was subpar. That is certainly not the experience we want our patients to have. Someone will be reviewing your visits and we will follow up with our staff accordingly. We hope we will have another chance to help you heal and feel better, fast, with the kind and compassionate treatment we strive for! Thank you again for alerting us to this.

name: Patricia Harrod-Wyrosdick
text: I went with flu symptoms and had had a virus (diarrhea and vomiting) for 4 days.  I also knew that I was dehydrated. The only thing that I didn’t know was that my blood pressure was elevated probably because of the flu.  I also had a severe headache which I assumed was associated with the dehydration and flu. I am quite sure the nurse practitioner could hear the rattling in my back whenever she listen to me breathe, however, she did not order an x-ray to see if I had pneumonia or walking pneumonia. I have been running 102 to 103 fever for the fourth day as well. The fever had gone down when I went in because I had just taken Tylenol before going. She gave me a prescription for some little pill for my throat and a pill for nausea.  She did nothing for my dehydration. I should’ve had an x-ray to see if I have pneumonia so that I could’ve been given an antibiotic. I feel like it was a complete waste of my time and money. I had to sit and wait a long time very sick in a waiting room full of sick people basically be told nothing more than I already knew and left there was nothing to make me feel better. I told her that I did not want to leave there under those conditions; however, that is what happened. Now, tomorrow I am probably going to have to go to another urgent care or emergency room to get the care and attention I need.  The receptionist was continuously sending people away telling everyone that came in after I was there that it was just too long of a wait so everybody would leave and say they would come back later. Possibly, they might’ve been overwhelmed by the amount of people they had, however, when I got there I asked how long the wait would be and she told me there was only four people ahead of me. I cannot explain their service, but I really go to a doctor and have never been to an urgent care, but this was certainly not a good experience for me. I am a 63 year old female and you should never play around with the health of anyone much less someone who is older.

resp.text: Patricia, I am so sorry you did not have a great experience with our clinic. Someone will be in contact with you soon to discuss your concerns in more detail.

name: doug davis
text: SLOW ,VERY SLOW!

name: Rachel Ballenger
text: Helped me with all my sickness and was well took care of and nice drs, nurses ,  and nurse practitioners

resp.text: Hello Rachel, thanks for the positive feedback! We're always happy to hear good things from our patients.

name: Ashlynn Pugh
text: Worst doctor ever I hate them so much

resp.text:
Hi Ashlynn,

We're sorry you had such a negative experience. We'd love the opportunity to learn more so that we can improve. When you have a moment would you mind emailing us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com and let us know more details about your visit? Thank you again for reaching out to us, and for providing us with your feedback.

name: Austin Robinson (TopIk)
text: Sat in waiting room miserable with fever for an hour before a nurse practitioner could see me and diagnose me with the wrong thing and give me no meds. I do not recommend this place to anyone with a serious illness. Lady at the front desk was also more concerned with Facebook on her phone than that i was very sick. I did not see any other patients in the building while I was there.

resp.text: Austin, I am sorry that your visit was not satisfactory. I have tried to locate you in our system so that I could call to get more information. Unfortunately, I am having a hard time pulling you up. If possible, please give me a call at 205-739-4879 so that we can discuss your concerns. Thanks!

name: Kimberlie Tarlton
text: Spent an hour and a half in the office. Staff is friendly. I was  told they had no answers and that I needed to follow up with primary or ortho. When I called back for a referral I was told there was no point in following up with an ortho. It wasn't a bad experience but I have no answers and I'm not sure what to do now.

name: Chelsea Hardrick
text: Don’t go here!!!!!!! They don’t actually care they are just trying to get people out of the door fast...with no help or cure. Save your time and money DONT GO HERE.!!

resp.text:
Hi Chelsea,

We hate to hear that your experience was unsatisfactory. We'd love to opportunity to follow up and improve. When you have some time would you please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with any details about your visit? We appreciate you reaching out!

name: Heather Brooke
text: Staff was so nice!! Fast service!! Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Thank you Heather!

name: Victoria Brignet
text: I have a few concerns. First you send all your labs out. How can you tell if someone has a bacterial infection or if it is a virus. I received one liter of IV fluids which was not enough which it showed in my vital signs. The only discharge information was to follow up with my GI doctor. Within 30 minutes I was starting to feel bad. I went to the ER several hours later and was feeling really bad. My BP dropped to 60/30.

resp.text: Hi Victoria! Thank you so much for your feedback! I’ll have our Chief Medical Officer review your chart to see what we could have done differently! We do have several in-house tests we can run for flu and strep, etc., but otherwise we do let the experts at Labcorp help us identify any uncommon viruses or bacteria.

name: Maggie G
text: I just left this office. The staff are completely incompetent. As a former RN, Legal Nurse Consultant, Nurse Investigator and Forensic Criminal Evidence Analyst, I’ve dealt with many physicians and their staff. I arrived in extreme pain from a pulled muscle in my back. I have been covered by UHC since 6/23/18. My cards won’t arrive until Monday. I explained this to the young man at the desk (Luis??) and the young blonde lady who came to “help” later. I had my membership and group ID in hand and even called United Health Care 5 times in front of them and on speaker for verification. UHC gave them the number to verify the insurance, only they couldn’t complete the process because they had no idea what their OWN tax ID number was! They needed this to complete verification through the automated process. After much frustration, I called UHC customer service back and the kind lady spoke with the man at the front desk DIRECTLY. They insisted they HAD to have the physical card. She explained they only needed verification and there was no more information on the card than what we had already provided (my Member ID number, the group number, and my Drivers license.) However, they DID need their own tax ID to complete the automated process which neither of them knew and neither bothered to investigate further (perhaps asking the doctor?!) Frustrated by their ignorance, she finally suggested I go elsewhere for medical  attention and mentioned for all to hear she had NEVER heard of anyone needing the physical card when they were clearly verifying coverage for me. I will NOT return and rest assured this will be all over my social media accounts as well. I did not appreciate their lack of caring or basic knowledge.

resp.text: Maggie, I am sorry that your visit was not satisfactory. Unfortunately, our billing department requires us to have either an insurance card or a verification form sent from the insurance company. We can not just take verbal authorization over the phone. However, I would like to get additional information to ensure that staff did exhaust all options to help you. If possible, please give me a call at 205-739-4879.

name: Taylor Self
text: Very fast! I was in and out within 45 minutes. The staff is very friendly.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We hope you are feeling better.

name: Gerald Barber
text: They got me in quick ran a couple of test and gave me meds for sinus infection. Overall great experience, the quickest I've ever been in and out of doctors office.

resp.text: Gerald, thank you so much for this sweet review. I hope you are feeling better.

name: J Padge
text: Got me in and out and with good results. Thanks!

resp.text: Glad we were there when you needed us. Please let us know if you need anything else.

name: Corey Thomas
text: Great! Got me in quick. Usually have to wait forever at Urgent Cares, this is the best one I have ever been to.

resp.text: Corey, thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review. Glad we were able to get you in and out quickly. Please let us know if you need anything else. Have a great day!

name: LeeAnn Miller
text: Front desk staff are VERY rude!! Spend more time playing then working.  No care for patients!!

resp.text: Thank you LeeAnn for reaching out. I have followed up with our clinic and addressed the insurance issue. In addition, please let me know if I can help you with anything else. Have a great day!

name: Connor Newman
text: Amazing and helpful staff!! LOVE MAINSTREET!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the sweet review! Please let us know if you need anything at all.

name: Elizabeth Whitfield
text: Doctor told us to go to the ER, told us we could possibly have a ruptured spleen when the ER found absolutly nothi wrong, awful wait time and would not recomend.

name: Spicuus Johnson
text: Sweet staff

name: ANGEL LANGLEY
text: Katie Adams was great with my 9 year nephew took up time talking with him about difficult time he his having.

name: Liz Morse
text: Hardly waited to be seen. The staff is very friendly! Thank you. #HIGHFIVE

resp.text: Liz, thank you so much for the review. Please let us know if you need anything else.

name: John Glenn
text: This place is a joke

resp.text:
Hi John,

We're sorry to hear you feel this way. Would you mind providing us with some additional feedback? Negative reviews are no joke, and we would love the opportunity to improve! Would you mind emailing me at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com or call 205-767-9633 so that we could discuss this further? Thank you for reaching out, and we appreciate your feedback.

name: Alexis Ohsner
text: They made me sit there with my daughter for an hour and when they took us to a room they said they couldn't see her because there wasn't a kids doctor there

resp.text: Alexis, please give me a call at 205-739-4879. I would like to get more information because we can see kids depending on the circumstances and if they are one or older.

name: Melina Fellers
text: Love this place

resp.text: Thanks for choosing MainStreet Family Care, Melina!

name: Jacob Grayson
text: Save yourself a trip and go else where have been here several times with my daughter myself nephews and wife have never had a decent visit the entire staff is rude and could careless about your well being or accurately diagnosis

resp.text: Jacob, I am sorry that your visit was not satisfactory and I tried giving you a call to get more information about your visit. If possible, please give me a call at 205-739-4879.

name: Paula Coker
text: Amazing service.

resp.text: Paula, thank you so much for the review. I hope you feel better fast!

name: Amylia Phillips
text: Would not take my insurance paperwork. I did not have a card but I provided all my insurance information in paperwork. I had to go through a stressful phone call o have someone send me a picture of the card. & then after paying my copay I was just referred to another office.

resp.text:
Thank you Amylia for reaching out. Someone will be in contact with you soon.

Amylia, I am having trouble locating you in our system. Can you please give me a call at 205-739-4879 so that we can discuss this further?

name: Wenn Willia
text: Very friendly staff

resp.text: Wenn, thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We hope you are feeling better.

name: austin rob
text: Have a fever been in the waiting room for 20 minutes no one has even checked up on the front desk

name: Fred Livingston
text: Great visit PA B. SMITH  was kind, explained fully what was going wrong with me.  She then went over in detail the medications she was perscribing. Great visit, I'm feeling much better and the 3 injections were painfree, thanks to the lady with the beautiful lashes.  Well done everyone !!!!

name: Courtney Lindsey
text: Crimson Urgent Care is a Great establishment! Their Doctors and Nurses are Amazing! They have a wonderful, and very nice staff, that really do care about your well-being, and health.

name: Shirley Garner
text: They always greet me with a caring smile. Their expressions don't change when I hand them my Medicaid card. They treat me with care and respect. At 72 years old, this highly appreciated, I'm sure, by more than just me.

name: Vivian Liveoak
text: Seems their phones only work one way.  You can call in, get told they will return your call by " sorry I missed you message",  but it never happens.   Even with drug stores.  Getting an update on a prescription is like pulling teeth.   You've heard that old saying.   So, you have to show up at the office to get the update and you NEVER get that call back.  And your prescription never gets the update til you show up in person.  Then when you show up they get upset and give you that nasty nice treatment.   So where is that old fashion you are the patient treatment.   Not the you are disturbing me treatment.   Or you don't have an appointment treatment  nasty get out of here look and attitude.   If all doctors offices are like this, where do you go?

name: Caleb Hiatt
text:
Disappointing.
I recently moved to town and was looking for a provider. I went the first time the wait time was long despite getting there when they opened. The doctor said she would take care of something that never happened and they sent my prescriptions to 2 different pharmacies. I figured I would give them another try so I went back I was the first person there and still waited 25 minutes to see the doctor (who I literally only saw for 2 minutes) I asked them to fill 90 days worth which they said they would. I went to the pharmacy to pick stuff up and they had only written 30 days. I'm done! Won't be back.

name: Angela Burton
text: It’s so hard to find good care with genuine concern. The staff was kind and friendly, I was very pleased and at ease. I  knew I was in the right place.I was given my paperwork and treated with kindness and respect all questions was answered politely. I was not waiting for a long period of time to see the doctor and much to my delight when she walked in she was just as amazing as the staff. She listened and heard all of my concerns ...she .did not brush  me off,,,and then she went from there. Absolutely love Crismon Care and I will gladly recommend it to all my family and friends. Thanks for a awesom experience.

name: Josie Rykhus
text: Very fast and went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and understood what they were doing and why.

name: Foster Brown
text: Don't go there if you need stitches. Took my wife this afternoon with a cut on her finger requiring stitches were told that the doctor doesn't do stitches. Isn't that taught in med school.

name: Katherine Woods
text: Fast and quick service!! All staff is wonderful and always so helpful to my medical needs. Thank you

name: Chelsea Channell
text: I walked in and they was super sweet and nice and helped me as fast as they could

name: Sebrenia Clancy
text: I have used Crimson Urgent Care Veterans parkway for years. Each employee that comes in contact with the public is courteous. The Doctor and the Nurse practitioner get an A.

name: Skyla Jones
text:
Horrible experience.  My husband and I literally went here for rapid covid testing. We were the first ones In The parking lot.   We had actually visited the other location on skyland earlier today.  After waiting an hour and being told they didn’t know how to input our insurance because “it was weird “ being bcbs of Michigan. We came to this one.
We waited hours.  We saw two different nurses wait on the same one patient in a car back to back. The lady brought the woman her dr’s excuse finally, about an hour and a half later.  Then there were about 9 cars waiting to be tested at this point.   We were only getting tested because we had 2 family members that had tested positive that we had been around.  Do not go here!!!! Go to Dch!! Or bear creek family to get ur results!!!!! They are 24 hours but they will get to you, quicker that 2 hours

name: Sarah Jamieson
text: Don’t come here for a covid test. Even if insurance covers it, they add in an extra fee claiming you saw a doctor. They never told me this and that never happened. I guess the provider just saying that I’ll get my covid results back in 24-48 hours is worth 21 dollars. I didn’t even leave my car. So stupid.

name: Tommy Morgan
text: Great service. very courteous and did not have to wait very long.

name: Kim Boothe
text: If I could have went anywhere else I would. The customers service isn't a priority here. I waited almost 3 hours, then 3 other ppl came in after me and got right back. This place isn't professional at all. I wished I wasn't sick and needing to get a excuse for work BC I would walk out of this horrible place

name: christen bonner
text: On December 18th I had to rush to Tuscaloosa due to a family member going to the ER bc of COVID and having symptoms. I needed to take my mom to have a COVID test completed bc of exposure. I do not live in Tuscaloosa so this place was close to the hospital. #1 we were there at 8am and the place didn’t open til 8:30am. At 8:30,while standing at the door in a line, the assistant didn’t welcome anyone or give instructions she just started placing signs everywhere and sitting out a stand with paper and a COVID test taking instructions. Because I used common sense I took two papers in order for my mom and I to fill out. Once completed I walked inside to turn in and completely fill out the document. We received our first call to bring back insurance cards. Because I’m from Ga, the receptionist asked for me to email a copy of my insurance card. She said she never received the emails so text her. She assured me that I had the correct email address three times. I had to text her my documents eventually. We took our test and we’re told 24-48hrs results. I went back to GA and my mom took a rapid test at another location and received her results.  Crimson care did not offer rapid tests. Two days later on Sunday the 20th I called to get my results and I was told they did not have them ready or could not find them. On Monday the 21st I called 8 times to speak with someone and 3 times I was hung up on. I finally had received an incorrect email address email from the wrong email address the receptionist gave me. Today is December 27th and my mother still hast received her COVID results from this place. Overall this place needs more training on customer service and delivery during these unusual times. The service was horrible and the administer of the test was horrible.

name: Lacharika Taylor
text: The staff here is very kind, and compassionate. It was my first visit here, and they made me feel very welcome. The wait is not long at all, and they be sure to answer all of your questions.

name: P Royster
text: Staff is very courteous and helpful. Way better than DCH

name: Carolyn Hamlett
text: Thank you all for professional service in the most caring way.

name: ISAAC ENGLUND
text: These people refuse to answer the phone. Could not reach anyone for 2 days. Also refuse to email me my COVID results and a terribly rude desk lady.

name: Imane Abhir
text: I had a very bad experience, the wait was too long almost 2 hours, and add another hour when you go inside to finally be seen, the nurse practitioner was very nice, very professional but the one who came to draw blood was the very unprofessional to say the least... Never ever again....

name: Ky Money
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful during my visit. I will definitely use them for all my urgent care needs!

name: Joey Gambarelli
text: Easy to work with, fast and simple.

name: Jonathan Beckham
text: Dr Permasetty is great. He helped me out rite off and actually wanted to help. He offers way more procedures and can do more then just about any Dr office. .

name: Jaynell Hughes
text: This clinic is very slow when it comes to getting things done. Went for a visit because my usual place closed early and got a covid, flu, and streptococcus test done. The doctor was and hour and half late because he was at another clinic. The healthcare worker who did my swab lost my covid test. I called again to see if they found my test and said my test came back inconclusive. I had to go back and get tested and had an hour wait time waiting outside just to face time and wait on a practitioner and get tested. Worst clinic I ever went to.

name: Lindsey Logan
text: This place is very professional and clean and caring.  I highly recommend

name: Ella Hurley
text: This single star is dedicated solely the amazing person, Justin, who helped me over the phone. The rest of the experience...horrendous. I went here last minute as my normal places were closed, was totally rushed through An exam, the medical staff was very nice except for the actual doctor I saw. I felt totally demeaned and belittled by her. I was prescribed medicine that I am highly allergic to and the doctor wanted to give it to me anyway, then prescribed medicine not for the right area of infection, then come to find out what I was prescribed ISNT TO TREAT WHAT I ACTUALLY HAVE. Ive gotten UTI’s all my life, I know all the meds for it. What I was given wont cure a UTI, and now I have to go pay another doctor to diagnose me and prescribe me the correct medicine. Please please dont go here because it’s open latest or the rating isnt so bad. It’s bad. Dont go. Wait til the morning or the next day, I wish I would have.

name: Chrystal Dawkins
text: I love this place. Very clean the Dr. & Nurses are very friendly and kind.

name: trisha gibson
text: Y’all don’t EVER answer the phone!!!! This is ridiculous! I witnessed you sit there and let the phone ring with 1 person inside. There were 5 people up front WHY CANT YOU ANSWER?! Smh I will NEVER use this place again.

name: Chris haley
text: Called all day then have you on hold for 35 minutes. Just slow as Christmas. And knowing they 👀 you calling.

name: Jessica Davis
text: This place is unprofessional don’t tell u no information of what’s gonna on when u have seen the doctor when ask for a doctor excused they put in somebody else name when u told the name 3 times to the nurse

name: Riley Raynor
text: I’m not sure if she was a doctor or a physician or practitioner but Bridget Smith was GREAT!! She talked me through what she saw and what she was going to give me for it. Took the time talk to me.. Really appreciate her and the nurses. Best experience yet.

name: Bruce Prescott
text: I have not been able to reach anyone in the office by phone and left messages online for someone to contact me regarding Covid results. No luck. I plan to follow up with my primary care physician and have the test completed again. Extremely disappointed with patient services.

name: salman Alotaibi
text: The main nurse was training the other nurses on me with injections. I wouldn't mind if they asked for permission but he was horrible, disrespectful, and spoke to me like I don't know how to speak English. Patients should not be treated this way. He should be checked or kicked out! 👎🏼

name: Mary Gardner
text: After getting hung up on by Morgan, I’ve come to realize crimson care puts money & insurance billing before making sure their patients have access to the medication THEY prescribe. So now, yet again I have to stop taking a medication cold turkey because they will not do a telemed call until they fix a billing issue they created. (My insurance was not saved on file correctly & my insurance company is closed right now.) Which is detrimental to my mental health. Thanks CCV. Not representing Dr P well.

name: Greer Jones
text: The only reason that there’s room for one star is because of the kindness of the NP I had while there. I’m self pay, meaning I don’t have insurance, which was made known from the moment I did paperwork. The doctor then wanted to do bloodwork to confirm some thyroid issues (which is absolutely what needed to be done.) Three days later, I had to talk to three different people to get results, which they told they’d call me about and never did. They told me to come back again for another panel and blood work. Again, I would have to call two days in a row to get my results from that test (they were in the system, but the doctor didn’t sign off nor did he ever discuss them with me). He told me he wanted to refer me out and I explained (for now the fourth time at this point) that I was self pay and was concerned about the cost of a specialist. He told me he could do medication on site and we’d wait for the blood results to confirm what he suspected. He later changed his mind and didn’t feel comfortable treating me, but he also misdiagnosed me, so I was taking ineffective meds. Now, almost two months later, I just received two bills for a total of $1200.00 for the blood work performed— blood work! And the company they use doesn’t offer deals or negotiations, so I’ll be on a payment plan for TWO YEARS for bloodwork. I was never told costs, even expected, and was still given these tests. I never would’ve had these tests done if I had known. I obviously went to a different doctor and had to pay $110 for the same bloodwork to be done because my new doctor couldn’t trust this doctor. My med records from this visit had presenting problems from 4 years ago listed as the main issue and they checked boxes for examinations they didn’t do.  Lesson learned— I will never go here ever again and would STRONGLY encourage everyone to seek treatment elsewhere. If you can’t, have them write out every cost in detail for you a and get every thing they say in writing. The absolute worst exper

name: Mark S
text: This place is absolutely terrible. I can’t tell you how many times I have had horrible experiences with this Urgent Care. They are unprofessional, in person and on the phone. Not a single response from them on the phone for the past four days. Let’s not even mention all of the other countless times they have been incompetent and I’m not the only one who shares the same thoughts.

name: Nicholas Shields
text: This my first visit to this clinic as a retired veteran and I can say they are very confident at what they do! From the doctor to the staff very confident. And there was  no hassle questions, told them what was need and the crew did it. In addition to the doctor's exam he also recommended additional items for my present condition.  All around I would give a 10 if I could, they handled business! Love it!!!

name: DAVID STEIN
text: The girls at the front desk was minus manners.  The receptionist snatched the form which I filled out completely and neatly as asked.  Then the other girl "demanded" my copay immediately and snatched my credit card from me.  There should be some staffing adjustment.  On the other hand,  the doctor and nurses and other staff in the back of the office were professional and proper.  I will not be going back there to be abused again.   Oh.   I had an almost three hour waiting time.  This office and Dr P deserves more respect than this.     I DEMAND MORE RESPECT THAN THIS.

name: Taneezia cook
text: Friendly employees and quick service

name: Natanya Vance
text: I’ve never felt so neglected in my life. The doctor rather take personal phone calls than to come and check on patients. I wish it was someone else I could talk to about the malpractice of this clinic but I’m pretty sure there isn’t. I’ll just have to take it up with my lawyer if something is really wrong. The medical machines were malfunctioning and he was made aware by his assistant and he still went with the faulty reading and dismissed me. I waited for 45 minutes to a hour just for him to come and tell me that I am fine even though I could tell something was wrong. Be very weary of Dr. P cause doesn’t do his job and rather laugh on the phone with his friends than to check on his worried, sick patients.

resp.text: We apologize for any problems that anyone may have experienced at any of our facilities. Please know our team tries to reach out to anyone that shares concern. We hope to learn from every good and bad experience.

name: Emma Milowski
text: Waited 2 hours just to get an antibiotic prescribed for my stomach bug... doctors were super nice though, although I was supposed to be next in line and 3 other people went in before me who had signed in after. I’m not sure if that was the receptionists fault but there should never be that long of a wait time just to talk to a doctor for a few minutes... something seems weird.

name: Abmiki Rii
text: They locked their doors at 6:30p on a Friday and refused to answer their phones

name: Scott Klatt
text: Cut on my finger was mistreated resulting in an infection that almost cost me my finger 6 weeks later still ongoing avoid their incompetence go elsewhere

name: Keneisha Simmons
text: I am writing this review as I continue to wait to be seen by a doctor. After paying a $40 copay (which is the highest i’ve ever paid) I have been waiting for 2 hours literally and time is still being added. I will not be back to this urgent care ever again! I don’t care how sick I am.

name: Sherry Harkness
text: My family and I had an awesome experience at Crimson Urgent Care. We were greeted warmly with smiling and friendly faces and given excellent customer service from the professional staff and doctor. I will recommended family and friends to visit here when feeling ill. Thanks again for the wonderful experience.

name: Patrick McGrew
text: Fairly fast on the in and out, and accurate. Haven't received a referral I was supposed to be needing, but don't know if it's their fault, mine or the other doctors office. Later they did follow up. But then months later I get an overdue bill for things either not done, or with confusing abbreviation next to a dollar amount.

name: Jahod A
text: Been here a couple of times, and the Doctors are always very knowledgeable and courteous.Overall one of the best Urgent clinics in Tuscaloosa.

name: Amber Nicole Smith
text: Love the doctors and staff here! Everyone is caring and a joy to be around! Highly recommend

name: Monica Taylor
text: Friendly staff and very helpful! I was a private pay and the doctor made sure he took care of me without running any unnecessary tests to help with payment. Would recommend 100%!!

name: Jessica lynne Card
text: Great quick care.   Very friendly staff

name: Tameka Harper
text: Friendly, and professional staff with great personality!!! Appropriate wait times for a busy day

name: Patrice Bailey
text: I was greeted upon arrival by the front staff. She checked me in and was informative as far as insurance and protocal. There wasn’t a wait, I was called back in a short period of time. The nurse worked me up and the Dr. came in shortly after. I didn’t spend an extensive amount of time there, which I prefer! in the medical and can appreciate my time being valued. And as far as the 4/5 rating there wasn’t anything that caused me to have a bad experience or “bad taste in my mouth” in layman’s term. I just believe there is always room for improvement!

name: Rodney Swiney
text: I have been trying to call them the past two days about my results from an ultrasound sound from dch that’s supposed to be sent to them but they seem to not know how to answer a phone call.

name: Harlyn Cowart
text: Crimson Care is amazing! The doctors there are always so nice and wonderful and helpful. Way better than SHC!! It’s also almost always super fast and they even helped me get in touch with doctors at home to get my tonsils out!

name: Lambert Jackson
text: My wife and I visit crimson care and we were very satisfied with staff and our care. We will surely use crimson care for our future medical needs. We really appreciated the service that   Dr. Romona Peterson provided us.

name: V-Selection
text: The facility is nice and everytime my daughter and I go, we're in and out! Exactly how I expect an urgent care visit to go! Thanks for being consistent

name: Nicole Martin
text: I have had to bring my children in short notice after hours when their doctor's office was closed and the service was excellent. The wait time was short, the staff was friendly and the doctor was in and out. Our needs were met exceptionally well within 1 hour. The nurse Matthew that works there is simply amazing!!!!

name: Dwanda Byrd
text: My mom has been using this facility and these Doctors for years. She has received quality, caring treatment. She is very particular about her treatment, as we all should be. She's been very pleased with the clinic. If momma ain't happy, ain't nobody happy applies with us. Momma is happy with Crimson Urgent Care.

name: Wanda Owen
text: Great first experience.  Very knowledgeable staff.  Quick service.  Will definitely use again.

name: Emily Lakey
text: I love seeing this staff.  I honestly have no complaints, as I have received continuously exceptional customer service from the nurses, administrators, and doctors here. The nurses go out of their way to make me feel comfortable and understand whats going on.  Dr. E is one of the best physicians I've ever seen.  He takes his time with you and makes it seem like he genuinely cares about helping you feel your best. I never feel rushed or uncomfortable.  I would recommend this office to everyone.

name: Brandi Aaron
text: Front desk staff are terrible and they are very rude. They are so unprofessional it’s pathetic. They leave you on hold until you hang up, it’s like their strategy make people wait forever so they don’t have to talk with them. I wouldn’t recommend this clinic to anyone not even a stray dog. I think they should replace the whole front staff with people who have better customer service, they are so uninviting they make you sicker than you already are. Don’t waste your time or money it’s not worth it!!!

name: Regine Jackson
text: I have been a patient here at Crimson Urgent Care since 2015. Service is always timely and professional. I haven’t had many issues with them if any at all! :-)

name: Dylan Mann
text: I highly recommend this facility. The doctors are nice and very quick to get you in and out. The front desk is very nice and makes you feel at home.

name: Smurf Pugh
text: Everyone was very friendly.  Did not have to wait very long. Everyone was very pleasant.

name: Adrianne Brown
text: They are always nice and speedy. Dr.s care about you and your family. This is a great clinic always been wonderful for my family.

name: Sharonda Magby
text: Being from out of town we had no primary doctor on Tuscaloosa. My son got sick and i took him. They were very professional and fast. I eventually went for myself. Staff was very empathic to my needs. I would recommend them.

name: Michael Reeves
text: I was in a great deal of pain from a toothache, and all the Dental places were closed. I went to see Crimson Care and they took good care of me quickly and efficiently. They were a lifesaver!

name: Kat Imma Kitty Kat
text: Love the doctor and everyone is so sweet. Highly recommended. The front desk is the best!

name: Britt Pickett
text: Courteous front counter and relatively fast service. But after my daughter was diagnosed with the flu and bacterial bronchitis apparently someone forgot to call in the prescription. By the time my daughter discovered their oversight at the pharmacy, Crimson Urgent Care was closed with no after hours or emergency contact info. Had to suffer through the night and most of the next day before the error was corrected.

name: Kimberly Griggs
text: I have been coming here for a year or better and I have NEVER had a bad experience. Even when there is a bit of a wait it beats going anywhere else. I have never waited for more than an hour in the waiting room and normally the dr is right in. The staff is very carrying and I normally go here when I have a migraine and they respect the fact that I am normally light and sound sensitive.  P.s I am here now with a migraine and although I am in severe pain I still feel the same way! Nicole has been an amazing nurse to deal with. She is a great nurse.

name: Marcus Daniels
text: The best doctor I ever met. Quick and talented.

name: Victoria Gilbert
