text: EXCELLENT SERVICE IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR  GREAT PHYSICIANS, NURSES AND STAFF. THE LADIES IN THE FRONT OFFICE ARE ALWAYS HELPFUL IN PROVIDED INFORMATION ABOUT NOT ONLY THE URGENT CARE FACILITY BUT ALSO THE OTHER FACILITIES THAT THEY ARE IN RELATION TO.

name: Grace Vanderlugt
text: This was one of the worst experiences I have EVER had in a health-care environment. Let me start out with saying they do have an amazing doctor. He is very kind, caring, and professional. The front desk employees are a different story, they are very unprofessional and do not know how to do their job. I think that they forgot what custom service means in a business environment. The front desk "forgot" to give me back my credit card which is okay, but when I came back the next day it was no where to be found. When I proceeded to ask about my card, the main front desk employee started to use racial slurs. I have never seen this type of behavior in a professional work place. I will not be coming back here and I do NOT suggest that you do either.

name: KeAngela Kennedy
text: The employees are pleasant. My daughter was in need of care. The staff was knowledgeable and was able to provide efficient care.

name: Jewell Sandoval
text:
Short wait time.  Nurse does the routine checks as soon as you enter the exam room. Dr. Peramsetty very pleasant, understands the problem and gives whatever is needed to clear up the issue.
Jewell Sandoval

name: Sheila McDowell
text: The staff was very friendly and efficient. I was in and out in no time. The doctor was very attentive, kind, and understanding. I would tell everyone to visit this Urgent Care facility.

name: BerryCute Printables
text: Left with a lot of questions. Went for urgent care and had to wait over an hour, there was 1 patient in front of me. I got to see the doctor for 2 minutes and he said I needed shots and left. Now reading other comments, looks like it's common for them to give shots (good way to bill more than needed). I couldn't believe I waited so long just to get antibiotics and shots, Doctor seemed in a rush so I didn't get all my questions answered. I don't even know exactly what those shots were. Bad business.

name: Bethanie Barrett
text: I urge everyone to choose somewhere else when picking an urgent care place. I went in with severe pain in my left buttocks that was shooting down my leg and into my foot. He literally just had me stand on my tip toes then on my heels and sent me away with "muscle spasms." The medicine that he gave me only made it worse. I'm going to get a second opinion as soon as possible. He spent more time giving me a lecture about general practitioners and how he can't prescribe narcotics, which I specifically asked him not to give me narcotics as I don't like them, then he did actually checking me out. Again, please go somewhere else.

name: Hue Nguyen
text: I come here all the time for all of my needs! Dr. Peramsetty has taken care me for as long as I can remember. The staff is so sweet and caring and they always go out of their way to make me feel better and my prescriptions and referrals were always done in a timely manner. I couldn't ask for more! :) Thanks guys!

name: Brandon Campbell
text: Great service great receptionists great doctors they know exactly what they doing and will get you in and out at a convenient time really recommend crimson to anyone in the Tuscaloosa area!!

name: Whitney Watson
text: This location is TERRIBLE- Do NOT visit! I have had medications prescribed to me that I told them I allergic to multiple times. I have also made specific, direct requests to the doctor for services that he has straight up ignored. Not worth the copay, no reliable service or treatment.

name: Pamela Richardson
text: Though the staff and physician were personable they really should not be practicing medicine.  My son was diagnosed with tonsillitis and given three injections and three prescriptions.  Two days later he was still very ill and I brought him to our family physician who immediately recognized his symptoms as mono and the test came out positive.  Though we have insurance - our copay is $40 and the three unneeded prescriptions cost over $100 out-of-pocket.  We had to pay all over again for a visit elsewhere and new prescriptions.  The pharmacist told me no less than 3 times that he would never ever recommend Crimson Urgent Care to anyone.

name: Michael O'Grady
text: this is my first and only review of an establishment. i had such a bad experience that i felt the need to write this. the doctor was fine, but the nurses and girls at the front desk have no position to be working in a place that deals w people's health. i was the only one in the lobby at the time, and pre-checkup paperwork took close to an hour because they didn't "believe" my insurance card. they ended up being wrong and i got to go in an hour after i walked through the doors. they were no help at all during the process. they then proceeded to send my prescription to the only CVS pharmacy that was closed for labor day. i called and asked them to change that, and this task took almost an hour. the only reason i went here was because it was the closest to my dorm. do not waste your money. you'll have a bad experience.

name: Jolene Jenkins
text: Doctor was very good. Nice clean place.. Nice staff..

name: truk272
text: Terrible service

name: Bianca Woods
text: Overall excellent service. Friendly staff with no long wait.

name: Vinny Trifilo
text: Staff was the best! Middle check in window chicken very cool!

name: Michael Alexander
text: The staff are very nice and took the time to look at a picture before they took me back

name: Jenny Shuttlesworth
text: Very clean, very friendly staff  and the wait time was not bad at all.

name: Angie Johnson
text: Never trust this location. They gave my son a shot that he was allergic to when he made it very clear that he was allergic to a relate medicine. He had a sever allergic reaction the next morning due to their bad medicine. Never again.

name: Rachel Miller
text: The doctors are great staff has a terrible attitude.

name: Amie McCarter
text: Loved it, the staff was great, quick and easy . No hassle.  Was well taken care of . On my road to recovery now and definitely recommend to everyone ik and more

name: ark gg
text: Staff is always supper nice and helpful an always take care of my parents

name: Tanya McFadden
text: The worst I went because I had pinkeye doctor didn’t even touch me. Didn’t look at my eye but they were real quick to collect that money. I won’t be back ever

name: McKenzie Kellar
text: One of the worst experiences I have ever had in a doctor’s office. The front desk staff was not helpful, they were extremely rude, and didn’t know how an insurance card works (didn’t make sense to me either). Would not recommend to anyone. If you are looking for an urgent care go to American Family Care on 15th!

name: Kevin Foote
text: Terrible! Don't go here. Went for urgent care and had to wait over an hour, and there weren't but 3 or 4 patients in front of me. Got a couple shots & left. Got a bill in the mail for $224, and that's AFTER my insurance paid their part. Itemized on the bill, the doctor's visit alone cost $425, and the bill total was $737. WHAT?!?? That's what I would expect an ER visit to cost, not a simple urgent care visit. I wouldn't expect to pay more than $60 to $100 for urgent care. I called the office to complain about the amount they're charging and the person I spoke with was rude and didn't really hear me out. She just kept talking about health insurance and how much they will pay according to my policy. That's not what I was upset about. I was upset about how much you charged in the first place! I will never go here again. Dr. Bobo at EmergiCare is much better & works much more efficiently to get you in and out of the door with the medicine you need to get back to good health without charging you a small fortune.

name: Brooks B
text: Dr E is SUPER NICE and very knowledgeable.  I will be back here.

name: Bill McIntyre
text: Great service from the moment you walk in. My families choice for our health care in Tuscaloosa, AL. Stop by when you're sick or if you're looking for primary care. You win't be disappointed.

name: Ali Mankey
text: Dr. Peramsetty misdiagnosed both my daughter and I. Infections cannot be treated with Tylenol and water. This is something they obviously didn't teach him in medical school. We have seen other good doctors there but I don't care to be treated by him and my children definitely will never see him again.

name: Redelle Easley-Howell
text: Dr. Peramsetty is AWESOME. The wait time is too long.

name: Nick G.
text: They are always on top of it and get me in and out quick with the right medicine. Also the doctors are super nice and get to know their patients.

name: Patti Howard
text: Doctors and staff are caring and efficient. The wait time is much shorter there.

name: consuela lewis
text: Dr. E is my dude!!!! I don't see Dr. P that much, but he's pretty cool as well and a great Doc. I Love the front desk staff and nurses. Keep up the great AWSOMTASTIC job over there you gys!!!

name: Arshad Abdul
text: good doctors & staff, excellent treatment provided.

name: Cindy Kunis
text: Absolutely terrible service, mean people and they won't cure your sickness. I took my friend there and they diagnosed her with gastroenteritis and gave her nausea medicine when she really had a kidney infection which was causing an infection in her blood. She later ended up in the hospital.

name: Rion Golden
text: Clean and comfortable waiting space. Well staffed. Short wait time.

name: Stephanie Ray
text: I though Dr. Peramsetty was really great, but found his staff (i.e. the nurses and receptionists) were extremely inexperienced and unprofessional. They made it extremely difficult for me to get a referral to another doctor I needed to see to resolve my condition and refused to give me the paperwork for my visit so that I could give it to the specialist I needed to see. I was in extreme pain and the staff at Crimson Urgent Care did as little as possible to help me alleviate that pain.

name: Grace VandeWaa
text: The people here are fast and very friendly. They even provided me with coupons for the medicines they prescribed me.

name: Monica Vasiliu
text: Please don't step in this clinic, its a waste of money and i mean lots of money!!! Really really bad service! Staff was nice and pretty fast (maybe cause it was spring break!!) but other than i have no words to describe it! went there twice 2 days apart for same problem, seen 2 different doctors, Dr Earla and Dr Peramsertty! They spent less than 5 minutes with me and charged the insurance for 25 min visit for $173 and $311!! How is that possible??And what they called it surgery for my infected finger was to prick the finger with a needle and squeeze it soooo hard for the puss will come out! And by the time i got home the puss starting building up again, and next day.. a Saturday i had to open all that infected finger by myself ( no way i was going back to the same clinic), made a big hole this time and let all that puss drain!! Again... do not waste your money for a bad medical service!  Hope somebody will learn from my mistake!!

name: Brad Yarbro
text: Everyone was very nice, and it didn't take too long to be called back to see the doctor. Will definitely go again when sick in the future.

name: Rylan Raye
text: I went to this place for severe abdominal pain at opening. I was the first person there but had to wait an hour and a half and was the last person in the waiting room to be called. I get back there and the doctor pushes on my stomach, says something about an infection, and gives me a prescription for antibiotics. Later in the day, as the pain was getting so bad I couldn't breathe properly, I went to the emergency room to find out I needed surgery. I will never go back.

name: Benjamin Brown
text: Low waits, friendly staff, and I never feel rushed. Not and old school family doc but easily a 5 star doc in the box.

name: Amelia Walker
text: Very nice people!! Go out of their way for their patients.

name: Barb Letterle
text: My son went here over the weekend.  He said the doctor was nice, but the office staff were very rude & insisted that he use the CVS pharmacy even though he wanted them to use Walgreens where he is in the system and they know his allergies.  They told him he had pharyngitis, gave him 2 shots and told him prescriptions were sent.  A day later & 3 follow up  phone calls to them later, the prescriptions were finally sent in.  He found out when he picked up the prescription that they prescribed him Augmentin which contains Amoxicillin- the only drug he told them he is allergic to!  By this time the urgent care was closed and he could not get an antibiotic that would help him.  So 2 days later, he still has no antibiotic he can take and I'm sending him somewhere else to be seen and treated properly.  He will never be returning here again!  Wish we would have read these reviews before coming- he would have went somewhere else!

name: Billy Perkins
text: myself and family have been seeing the drs here for years and they are great,i manage a buisness here in town and they always get me and out

name: Victoria Kelley
text: I went to this clinic after I had an allergic reaction to an insect bite. I waited for over a hour and a half, the doctor spent less than 5 minutes with me. Weeks later I received a bill of an additional $50 dollars and when I asked what is was for I was told it was "a new patient fee." When I asked to see a breakdown of my bill I was told, "The doctor circles one of two charges on the chart, the $125 or the $175. He circled the $175 on your chart." This answer was not the itemized bill I asked for. I will not go back to this place.

name: Octavia Kelly
text: Love it. DR's are friendly and prompt. Great bedside manners.

name: addison matter
text: This place is a joke. Doctor peramessety did the same thing to me as a previous review.. Didn't even LOOK at my chart and prescribed me the ONE thing I told the nurse I was allergic to which was bactrin. He walked in looked and me for maybe 3 seconds and said I'll send you something to cvs.. And that was it!!!!! Didn't even look at my infection or anything.. I was told he rushes people in and out and to go to the partner one in north port but my god I was shocked at how crappy he was.

name: Crystal Fix
text: Probably the worst “urgent care” I have ever been to. Waited almost 3 hours to be seen and was only told I still had several people in front of me. Should probably change their statement on their website saying “in and out in a hour” false advertising

resp.text: Crystal we are so sorry for your experience, when this usually occurs it is due to a high voulmn of patient load that is unexpected. We make all attempts to get people in and out in about an hour, we do however take the patient care seriously, and in some cases it takes longer than others when assuring the best care. It appears to have been so in your case, and we would like to apologize. We hope you will still stop by and see us soon so we can give you the best care as well.

name: J. Lewis
text: I'm sorry to have to leave a bad review, because the doctor is incredibly friendly and nice. Two problems here: 1, it's $35 more expensive than EmergiCare, and, more importantly: the doctor here misdiagnosed an allergic reaction I was having to antibiotics as another infection and prescribed more antibiotics. Not only that, but he prescribed amoxicilin even though I told him I was allergic to penecilin (they're the same drug). The next day I went to Emergicare and, two antihistamine shots later, I was perfectly fine. Friendly doctor, but I've been through a week of hell because of his misdiagnosis.

name: Holly Whatley
text: Very caring and friendly! For the best care this is the place to go!

name: Lakesha Tillman
text: Love CUC and its staff. Dr. P is the best!

name: Portia Jones
text: Always a quick visit, with a very caring staff.

name: Brad
text: Friendly  people,  Knowledgeable Doctors. Fast reliable results.

name: Samuel Stockman
text: Service was great. A little wait but friendly staff

name: Robert Grant
text: Very friendly and courtious staff. Super short wait times

name: James H Black Jr
text: I was taken care of very professionally

name: Katie Davis
text: I liked that I am able to walk in and be seen quickly.

name: Amanda Steele
text: Fast and quick service. Friendly environment.

name: Pam Hunnicutt
text: My whole family goes to him, he is great.

name: Teresa Tingle
text: Very nice staff and concerning

name: Steven Fondriest
text: Very quick, Kind/Helpful staff and doctor

name: Rachel Yarbro
text: Quickest care in town.

name: Eric Harper
text: I’ve been going to Crimson Urgent Care for the past couple years. They are conveniently located and the service is always top notch.

name: Stephanie kaiser
text: Great service nice area!!

name: Miranda Watts
text: They were quick and knew what they were doing

name: abhishek srivastava
text: Very rude staff !

name: Robert Darnell
text: The doctor I went to was extremely clueless. I told him I had stomach pain around my appendix and he told me I had a stomach infection and gave antibiotics. Here I am 3 days later in the hospital with an appendicitis that's already ruptured.

name: Malinda Jackson
text: I love coming here

name: Dorothea Rhodes
text: Excellent service....

name: Andre Colombel
text: My first reaction came from seeing how clean it was and the welcome from the receptionists

name: Annie Culverhouse
text: Awful customer service. They were very unprofessional and rude. They seemed to not care at all. The doctor didn’t even look at the X-ray..

name: haley azwell
text: The wait wasn't long the first time i went and they were super sweet!!

name: David Ewing
text: Clean facility and fast service

name: Selena Hicks
text: Good service.

name: Savannah Baswell
text: Great staff

name: Cynthia Thompson
text: Cool and friendly staff

name: Kris Pourchot
text: The two ladies at the front desk were very rude.

name: Breanna Brown
text: Will, never go there again. Doctor diagnosed me without even looking at me took weeks to get results from test ran.

name: Cory Abercrombie
text: Slow but nice people

name: Erin Giles
text: Not open 7 days a week. Today is Sunday. Website says closed. Billboard says open 7 days a week.

name: Hannah Lott
text: This staff is absolutely amazing!! The receptionist, the nurses, the nurse practitioner, absolutely everyone there is amazing!! They try their best to get you in and out as quickly as possible. They are so friendly and make you feel so comfortable. They are very personal with children to make the kids feel comfortable and like they aren’t even at a doctors office. They seen my son, Bentley, my daughter, Grace and myself all together, when I never expected them to, they just did it to make it convenient for us. This staff is truly wonderful and everyone of them deserve a raise. My husband and I LOVED bringing our children here!

name: Lillian Jackson
text: I was told when I arrived that there was a two hour wait and that I could sit in my car until they called. I asked them if they would still take me even if they hit closing time and they said yes. It hit closing time and I was one of the only people left waiting, and I got a message that my appointment was cancelled. When I went up to the window, they had locked the doors. I knocked, they saw me, and hid. They ignored me, and I had to leave after waiting two hours. I was in a lot of pain, and I needed to be seen. :(

name: Amy Smith
text:
My husband and I each had an Instant Covid-19 test here (both were negative). We provided all of our BCBS insurance information and we thought everything would be covered, or at least mostly covered… Nope! Apparently mainStreet Family Care in Mobile is not in the BCBS Ntwrk. Be warned if you have certain BCBS Insurance or don’t have insurance at all you’re going to pay $125 a pop.
My husband and I each received a bill this week saying we owe $125.00… $250 for both of us! $250.00 out of our pockets for Covid tests…. Well technically it looks like the majority of the bill is for “management of a new patient”. That seems pretty high to me. Those were fees that we were not expecting. I wish we had known ahead of time. Hopefully this review helps somebody else avoid a surprise bill in the future. I definitely would have gone somewhere else and will not be back. Not to mention, it was about an eight hour wait.

name: Cassie Armitage
text: They were all so nice! I had to wait a little bit for my Covid IV and One of the nurses bought me lunch. I believe her name was Ellen. So amazing!! I feel for anyone in health care rn and no one here seemed down. I would recommend 10/10

name: Kimberly Black
text: HIPAA violation at my appointment. The person checking me in at the desk (who did not seem like she wanted to be there or want me there) asked me to check in online. I sat down across the room to do so with 2 other people in the room and she asks me across the room what I am being seen for. I asked her if she was supposed to ask me that in front of everyone and she said "well there are some things we don't treat here." There are other ways to go about this, i.e. lists or just waiting the 3 minutes for me to complete my online check in which tells you my ailment. I had to call out that I had a UTI in front of two other men. It felt embarrassing and really inappropriate. The only reason they are getting 2 stars is because the staff in the back were very kind and friendly it was mostly the front desk issue.

name: Keely Nicholas
text: I used to really like this place. They were open late and the staff was super friendly.  My appt yesterday changed my mind. I was perscribed two medications and asked what pharmacy I use. Unfortunately I didnt know my pharmacy closes early on Saturdays until i got there to pic up my meds. I immeadiatly called Main St thinking they coukd send my medicine elsewhere. They were closed. At 4pm. double cheked their website and confirmed that their clinc is open 7 days a week until 9pm. I was frustrated but there was  nothing to be done. I called them this morning and explained the situation. I was told by reception that they were busy and no one hsd time. I told her i was in pain and im sorry to inconvenience them but i really needed my medicine. She said she woukd try to get the PA to send it in but it woukd be a little while sincd they were do bus . I told her its fine-, gave her the nsmr of the pharmacy and asked to be called or texed when it was done. She said she woukd take care of it. That was a lie. I called my other pharmacy and thdy had no idea what i was talking about and i wasnt in their system. I called Main Street again and got the same message saying theg are closed. Im incredibly frustrated abd in severe pain. I expected better. They also let a person who was thde for Covid testinv wait in the waiting room with meand another paiten . Ill be calling their headquarters  in the morning

name: Noflave Dave
text: Had a great experience here! Staff was super friendly and helpful.  They spent alot of time explaining everything to me and going over my treatment plan. I was very impressed with the level of care at this facility. From the front desk to the nurses and to NP were top notch and I hope this company realizes what valuable assets they have here. Keep up the good work ladies!

name: Kay Handley
text: I spent 20 min. registering for a covid vaccine.  I received confirmation that I was registered, and that I would be notified when my time came.  They sent me a text to come in for my shot, and then called me right after to inform me that they are not giving covid vaccines.  What's going on here?  They obtained my personal information, including credit card info, under false pretenses.  I gave them that information because their website said they are giving vaccines.  It was only after they had all my info that they called me and said they aren't giving vaccines.

name: Paul Hester
text: The staff was awesome. Everyone was so helpful. And the lady's on the counter . When out of there way to help me get a conv 19 test . I would recommend anyone to go there.

name: r a (RA21)
text: They were very fast, friendly and efficient!

name: LeAnn Miller
text: Very impressed! Staff and doctor were all extremely nice and helpful and answered all my questions. The kindness and care they showed is such a rare thing. I don't normally leave reviews but I was so impressed that I had to :) You have a new patient! (By the way, the injections worked and I'm finally able to breathe! Thank you!)

resp.text: This is so great to hear! We're happy you're feeling better!

name: Honeybun
text: Not sure why an urgent care office wouldn’t be answering their phone at a time like this... you would think they would pick up so they could control the walk ins during covid 19. All I wanted to do was call and cancel my appointment but I’m not even able to do that! Very unprofessional and I’m sure during a pandemic not advised, someone needs to visit them and give them a citation!!!I just know they BETTER NOT charge me for not showing up it’s not like they respond to the portal cancellations either 🙄

name: Caramel Libra Girl
text: Terrible service. DO NOT BRING YOUR SICK CHILD HERE!! They don't care about children at all. Go to the ER or your primary care provider. I could write a book about the mistreat I recieved here. Again, Greater Mobile Urgent Care is the best urgent facility in Mobile. This place is a joke.

resp.text:
Hi Caramel,

Thanks for reaching out! We'd like the opportunity to follow up regarding your experience. When you have a moment would you mind emailing us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com to provide us with some more details about your experience? We appreciate the opportunity to make this right!

name: Jessica
text: They did a excellent job

name: Courtney Washington
text:
Please do not utilize this facility COVID 19 testing. They have a 10 day turn around and blaming it on LabCorp. LabCorpis sending results to providers within 4 days. This urgent care is not posting or updating results in a timely fashion. Use some other provider. They do not even respond to the portal messages
.

name: Elisa Blackburn
text: I am terribly sorry, but I potentially exposed your waiting room to COVID-19 today. You see, I came in Saturday for urgent care, and they told me is need to get a referral from my doctor in 72 hours, and my primary care doctor gave me a paper to bring to your front desk. I tried to take care of it over the phone, seeing as my PCP submitted the referral through the internet, but the front desk girl had "no idea what to do here" and kept putting me on hold to speak to someone named Erica. The first time was 20 minutes, then I hung up and called back, because this is something front desk ladies have been able to do at other medical offices. The second time, the front desk girl got snappy with me, explaining that there was a waiting room full of people waiting JUST for Erica. I explained to her that I'd had to receive COVID-19 testing this morning, and I didn't want to risk bringing the paper in, but this was a time sensitive issue, according to the paper this very office gave me. She told me I needed to stay home and wait on hold. I waited another 10 minutes on hold before I got in my car. I came in wearing a mask and explained to the front desk lady that I needed to give her the paper, which took all of like 20 seconds. I asked her if this could have been done over the phone, and she told me OF COURSE. I showed her where I was still on hold on my cell phone, making it over an hour on hold to get to Erica. So, I'd like to thank Erica and the sassy front desk lady for potentially helping to spread COVID-19, by putting me in a position where I either had to come in (despite potentially having COVID-19), or risk getting stuck with a bill I could not afford, due to their lack of time management. Oh, and the waiting room when I came in? Maybe 2 people in there!

resp.text:
Hi Elisa,

Thank you for reaching out! We are truly saddened that your experience was not as great as we would have liked. We take bad reviews very seriously, and we would like to ensure that your experience is better next time. We have followed up with our staff regarding your experience.

name: Gabrielle Anderson
text: The healthcare providers at MainStreet helped me out with my work physical exam and paperwork. They were very friendly and reasonavly priced. Thanks for a great visit!

name: Brother Smitty
text: Very nice staff. Little bit of a wait.

name: Jaicenta
text: Very great staff!! polite ,friendly, and take care of your needs properly.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing Jaicenta! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Tabitha Grace
text: Do not use them! Came in 2 hours before closing and was rudely informed that it was 2 hour wait. Then the nurse came out and said did you tell them about the wait. An urgent care facility with zero compassion!! I left because I did not want people like that to treat my son. It was ridiculous!

name: Channing Cope
text: What type of COVID test is done here? Is it PCR Nasal Swab test?

name: Tiffany Gillerlain
text: The staff does not get enough credit for what they are going through during Covid. I witnessed all the staff members going above and beyond while I was there.

name: Brittany Gray
text: This pplace turned away my 6 month old more than once when she was sick don't go here

name: Jennifer Thomason
text: I haven't been there but what is the point of having a written referral from my childs actual dr for insurance? If I could get that I would take them there. Can you please explain this to me?

resp.text:
Hi Jennifer,

Trust us, we wish we didn't have to jump through such hoops too! While Medicaid and AllKids recently eliminated this requirement, certain BCBS plans require that we submit this referral before they'll pay for the services we provided. Thankfully, you have 48 hours after the visit to get this referral, so you can get the care you need, when you need it, and let us help get the paperwork finished afterwards! Thanks again for reaching out!

name: Megan Morgan
text: I have tried this place three times and each time, I have had an awful experience. They treat me like I am an inconvenience to them, but they sure don’t mind taking my money. They act like they do not care at all. I do not recommend!

resp.text:
Hi Megan,

Thank you for sharing, and we are sorry your experience was not satisfactory. We'd love the opportunity to follow up with our staff and improve. If you could, email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com and let us know any specific details about your visit, and how you feel we could make this right! Thank you again for reaching out.

name: Haleigh Parker
text: Okay so as with KidsStreet I was skeptical. I read bad review after bad review. So I originally didnt want to go. We went with myself and my daughter. They took the time to listen to all of my symptoms. My doctors office couldnt get me in and gave me something that made me sick . the staff at main street listened to everything i had to say . paid attention to my medicine allergies. They were able to get to the root of the problem and give me the medicines I needed to get better . As with kids street, I would definitely recommend main street. And I would go back if I needed to.

name: Hillary
text: Very clean and very fast! They get right to the point and I will definitely be using them again!!

resp.text: Thanks, Hillary! We're so glad we could help you heal and feel better. Thanks for choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Steph Andry-Wilkinson
text: From the moment we walked in we were treated with great care and concern. Kids Street made it very easy for my five-month-old to be seen since we were from out of town. We went to other facilities and walked out. This office is amazing  thanks for all your help !   P.s.   Excellent self-pay option I will highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Steph! We're happy we could help your little one feel better fast!

name: Amber Morrison
text: Erica is sweet and patient with all the kids, especially when it's busy! I appreciate her kindness even when the waiting room is full :) Kaylan and Christopher are quick, efficient, and accurate when providing patient care. They really put the kids at ease.

resp.text: Thanks Amber!

name: Jonathan Morris
text: Don’t come here unless you want the most generic of care. Type A flu, and couldn’t even get a prescription of comfort meds because they don’t have an MD on staff. Waste of time and money, just go wait at the ER.

resp.text:
Hi Jonathan,

Thank you for reaching out. We're having our staff and management review your chart to see what we can do to help you feel better. We'll reach back out through our message thread on Facebook to keep you updated. Thank you again for reaching out with your concerns!

name: Diane Harris
text: Usually use another facility but decided to try this one since it was close to my home. Very nice and accommodating outer waiting room but after being placed in a room, the wait was too long! My daughter’s regular doctor and my usually urgent care  is 1/2 the wait time. The outer lobby did not have any patients so I expected to be seen more quickly. Total time: 2 hours 30 minutes!

resp.text:
Hi Diane,

We're sorry your experience was not satisfactory! Our goal is to always get our patients in and out within an hour. We are reviewing your chart so we can follow up with staff to see why your visit took so long. Since we are still new there in Mobile, I'm sure they're working out some kinks to make everything go a bit quicker. We hope we will have another opportunity to help you and your family feel better fast! Thank you for reaching out and for choosing KidsStreet Urgent Care!

name: Michael Looney
text: I'm not really one to post negative reviews like this but I wanted to share the experience I just  had. I was skating at the skating rink (thinking I was alot younger than I actually am), fell extremely hard and landed on my finger.  I came to this urgent care at 8:40 p.m and the website and sign said they were open until 9:00. All of the lights and signs were turned off when I walked up to the door. Although the lady at the desk initially saw me I stood out there for several minutes. Finally she came out and said they saw their last patient at 8:30. I told her that I just needed someone to look at my finger to tell me if it was definitely broken and she said they couldn't do it. Honestly I just want her to read this so that she knows how much she let me down.

resp.text:
Hi Michael,

I am so sorry for your negative experience and we will certainly be following up with our staff and take appropriate disciplinary action. Our company policy is that we accept patients all the way up to closing time and we do not have a cut off time. If you experience this in the future you can immediately contact the corporate office at 205-545-5090 or reach the clinic manager’s cell by calling the local clinic, pressing option 4, and then option 2. Thank you for alerting us to this issue!

name: Roslyn's Dad
text: Nice waiting room free refreshments, friendly staff. The wait was a little too long only because the computer was acting up and the doctor didn't do to much when I was seen only talk, but overall good experience minus the wait and a little more intent on explaining medical issues to people such as causes, treatment, and etc. Would recommend if not for a serious concern of health

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Roslyn!

name: David MCclendon
text: Just seen one of your cars at Walgreen's on McGregor and airport blvd. Parked in a handicap spot with two children in the car. The one child was not in a booster seat and the driver was holding the newborn baby in her lap while driving and no one was wearing a seat belt.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention David. We have addressed this with the employee in question.

name: Erica Johnson-Arrington
text: The Staff at Main Street Urgent care is phenomenal. Amber Morrison-CRNP take time with each patient to provide optimum care. She's awesome and very suitable for her position. Rachel Dargan is Awesome! she is very kind and gives excellent advice. Rachel Carter-CRNP is an awesome provider. She gives wonderful health management advice & has a great approach! Christopher C. , Kaylan Short, Brittney, Spring, and Victoria are the best MAs any clinic could ever ask for. Despite what the patient count is  they are sure to take care of each patient fully and is the ideal Medical Assistants.

resp.text: Thanks Erica!

name: Tashia Bridges
text: Great customer service

name: Ashley Lassiter
text: Dr. Johnston and her staff were phenomenal. In and out in under an hour. Incredibly professional yet friendly. Only using Main Street from now on.

resp.text: That’s a BOOM! Thank you for sharing Ashley! So glad we could help!

name: Kimberly Theresa
text: Fantastic service. The staff is truly amazing. The waiting area is perfect.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Kimberly!

name: Conrad Bates
text: Sitting here now.  There was one patient before me.  Been sitting here for 45 minutes and still not called back.

resp.text:
Hi Conrad,
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us! We’re sorry to hear you had a negative experience, and we’ll certainly follow up with our staff. We always strive to get our patients in and out in under an hour, but I know with cold and flu season upon us, it can increase wait times a bit. Thank you again for bringing this to our attention and don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any additional feedback!

name: Scott Mckissick
text: Don't let applicants know whether they got the job or not, which resulted in loosing another job offer. Terriable unprofessional.

resp.text: Mr. McKissick, we are trying to locate your application. Would you have applied with another name? We accept all applications through our website, and we have several that apply. Once you go through our extensive interview process and a decision is made we always notify our applicants with our decision.

name: Shayla Thurman
text: Didn’t even get a chance to go in the office. Just calling and asking a question the phone experience made me go to another urgent care. Rude staff.

resp.text: Hi Shayla! Thank you for letting us know about your experience! That is certainly not the level of patient care that we expect from our staff and we’d like to follow up. Can you tell me what date and time you called so that we can follow up?

name: Jacob Huff
text: great place

resp.text: Thanks Jacob! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet!

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great facility!!
